revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-28 19:23:30.000000000', 'message': "Revert changes to monkey_patch.

As a work-around to deal with bug 1075838, we modified
monkey_patch in the Cinder binaries.  The root cause of the
issue is/was actually a bug in eventlet but this was a quick
work-around.

Since the change Change-Id: I69ba75136e32e95c6fdf108f0c4fe21a5e3bdbe6
to do this landed, the problem has also been addressed in Keystone.

So, let's revert this patch to get back the greenthread performance
that we may have lost with this change.  For now, everything should
be addressed as long as we don't implement multi api worker in Cinder,
if we do and the evenlet fix hasn't been released we'll need to turn
the modification back on for bin/cinder-api.

Change-Id: Ie845bade85dbceacd91f15e082325602d9a79c74
"}]
commit_message:
Revert changes to monkey_patch.

As a work-around to deal with bug 1075838, we modified
monkey_patch in the Cinder binaries.  The root cause of the
issue is/was actually a bug in eventlet but this was a quick
work-around.

Since the change Change-Id: I69ba75136e32e95c6fdf108f0c4fe21a5e3bdbe6
to do this landed, the problem has also been addressed in Keystone.

So, let's revert this patch to get back the greenthread performance
that we may have lost with this change.  For now, everything should
be addressed as long as we don't implement multi api worker in Cinder,
if we do and the evenlet fix hasn't been released we'll need to turn
the modification back on for bin/cinder-api.

Change-Id: Ie845bade85dbceacd91f15e082325602d9a79c74

'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-11-01 08:46:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think it's good to have cinder perform auditing regularly but I have some concerns about putting auditing job into periodic task due to in-predictable time to do auditing.  

We have to consider situation like: one volume service have tens to hundreds of existing volumes to report, and it takes > periodic_interval for reporting to finish. In this case, other periodic tasks, such as reporting service capabilities, will be affected by auditing (run less frequently than it should be), which in turn will hurt scheduling correctness/efficiency."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-01 10:14:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Note that each daemon will only notify for volume it handles on its host, so that mitigates what you describe, I hope. But anyway, your comment still makes sense in huge loaded hosts.

Question would be, how much asynchronous is the notification? Is this really going to take minutes?

Finally, if you really think this might be a problem this can be moved to a new daemon.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-01 18:14:18.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-11-02 00:37:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (1 inline comment)

Same concerns as before."}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2012-11-05 17:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I am really confused as to the purpose of this patch. 
Cinder (and other openstack projects like Nova) _already_ emit various instantaneous events. (in this case volume.create.* and volume.delete.*) that can tell you when usage changes. 
The audit ('exists') events are meant to:

a) provide a sort of 'double entry bookeeping' style check, incase a system downstream looses an event. (as in "hey ,I got 9 creates for this period, but the audit says there is 10 volumes..." 

b) make it so that usage systems do not need to keep historical event data for longer than 1-2 audit periods. 

c) report some 'periodic' usage, i.e., in Nova "I used x bandwidth on this instance in this time period". This dosen't affect cinder, atm, since it doesn't report such usage. (And breaking that out into a separate event may not be a bad idea, either. But it will still need to be periodic.)

Without the audit_period we cannot do any of these. 
If more info is needed for usage, we should be enhancing the instantaneous events, or adding new ones, not changing the audit event.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-05 18:23:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Dragon

> I am really confused as to the purpose of this patch. Cinder (and other openstack projects like Nova) _already_ emit various instantaneous events. (in this case volume.create.* and volume.delete.*) that can tell you when usage changes.

Those events are insufficient for the way ceilometer meters usage because we want to ensure we know about resources even if we miss their creation event.

> The audit ('exists') events are meant to:
> a) provide a sort of 'double entry bookeeping' style check, incase a system downstream looses an event. (as in "hey ,I got 9 creates for this period, but the audit says there is 10 volumes..."
> b) make it so that usage systems do not need to keep historical event data for longer than 1-2 audit periods.

The length of time the data is kept and granularity of queries ceilometer supports are different from the existing auditing system. In order to support all of our use cases, we need the events to come more frequently. The receiver will deal with auditing periods, aggregating data, etc. The sender should not have to worry about any of those requirements, so it becomes simpler by always sending an exists notification for each resource it knows about.

> c) report some 'periodic' usage, i.e., in Nova "I used x bandwidth on this instance in this time period". This dosen't affect cinder, atm, since it doesn't report such usage. (And breaking that out into a separate event may not be a bad idea, either. But it will still need to be periodic.)

The "usage" for cinder is the storage being consumed, and we do want to know that so that ceilometer users can bill for it if they choose to do so.

> Without the audit_period we cannot do any of these. If more info is needed for usage, we should be enhancing the instantaneous events, or adding new ones, not changing the audit event.

The intent here is to eventually replace the auditing done by cinder, and the other projects, by moving it to ceilometer and making auditing for all resources consistent.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-05 18:24:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 236, 'date': '2012-11-05 21:32:09.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

@Doug

>Those events are insufficient for the way ceilometer meters usage because we want to ensure we know about resources even if we miss their creation event.

Yes, the audit is designed to allow systems to catch that. 


>The length of time the data is kept and granularity of queries ceilometer supports are different from the existing auditing system. In order to support all of our use cases, we need the events to come more frequently. The receiver will deal with auditing periods, aggregating data, etc. The sender should not have to worry about any of those requirements, so it becomes simpler by always sending an exists notification for each resource it knows about.

How frequently do we need? The time period for audits is configurable, it can be set to hourly. And above is what the current events already do. 

>The "usage" for cinder is the storage being consumed, and we do want to know that so that ceilometer users can bill for it if they choose to do so.

I was referring to usage data that is intrinsically over a period of time (like bandwidth data: X gb transfered in y time period). Currently, cinder's usage is absolute (x GB).
If things like i/o usage were reported it would be a concern, but that isn't reported atm.  

> The intent here is to eventually replace the auditing done by cinder, and the other projects, by moving it to ceilometer and making auditing for all resources consistent.

What I am worried about is that these notifications are an integration point. Various users (including Rackspace)  have existing internal usage systems that bill off of these events. (This is not so much a worry for Cinder, as we monitor usage differently there, there was mention of porting this change to Nova. That cannot be done as is, since it would break existing users. For Cinder, it wouldn't affect us (I cannot speak for other users of OS), but this would leave Cinder with a different model for usage notifications than Nova or other OS projects. )
Basically, I'm worried about non-backwards compatible changes to an integration point. 

To get Cinder running, and solve ceiliometer's needs, perhaps we could change the event_type for these notifications (to volume.usage or similar?) to eliminate any confusion with the different nova .exists model? 

Also, we need to have a configurable time period on these, every 60 seconds is too often.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-06 09:43:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

@Monsyne

I'm ok to leave the old audit code as it is. I deleted because I though it was useless to everybody, since it has been broken for a while (ever?) before I fixed it by the end of September.

I'll rework the patch not touching this part, and sending different event name. What about using 'volume.exists' and changing audit events to 'volume.existed'? It would make more sense to me. :) But 'volume.usage' would be fine I guess otherwise."}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-08 11:11:02.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 5.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-08 13:02:39.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/15115/5/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/17660 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-08 15:00:28.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 5: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-08 15:04:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 6.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-08 15:26:26.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Works for me

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-14 13:27:11.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 2759, 'date': '2012-11-16 15:17:57.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Given recent discussion around Nova/Celiometer about periodic task on mailing list (http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-November/002920.html) is still on-going (without conclusion), I'd suggest wait until we have better solution to address those 3 issues before we proceed."}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-21 12:39:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Would it be possible to go ahead and merge this now so we can have *some* auditing of cinder, if we commit to work on updating it when the periodic task changes land in oslo? As it is, we can't reliably meter cinder volumes, which makes billing for them difficult."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-23 02:07:07.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

Just to be sure an additional config option is needed, here's a question ... does it seem likely that anyone would want to enable notifications in Cinder, but not want these notifications emitted?"}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-11-23 17:37:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

To Dougs point, I'm OK with moving forward on this so that progress can be made.  Yes, I would agree with everything stated about moving it into OSLO, and think that should be a rquirement if/when OSLO is ready for that but I don't want to continue blocking progress on the Ceilometer side.

To Russell's point, yes (unfortunately) I think this might be a reasonable scenario, but I'll let Julien provide a detailed response on that."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-23 22:37:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

I don't need a detailed response.  I was just trying to do a sanity check on it and wanted someone to ack it.  :-)"}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-24 02:45:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

@Russell - I think that option is there for parity with the other projects, where create/delete/update notifications may be sent separately from auditing notifications.'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-24 12:51:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

I do think that an option is likely a good idea. :)'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-24 12:54:46.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 1669, 'date': '2012-11-24 13:19:57.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-24 13:38:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

Ignore me. I misread your last comment and came to the wrong conclusion.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-12-02 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-12-02 06:03:01.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-31 16:11:58.000000000', 'message': 'volume: real-time audit

Change the old audit mechanism to a new one, like used in Quantum, that
sends "exists" notifications regularly for each host where cinder-volume is
running.

This allow programs like Ceilometer to consume this notifications and record
in real time the actual usage for volumes, rather than doing later.

Change-Id: I3c4b06125615ff28dca275886e4d3aaeb1c1513e
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
volume: real-time audit

Add a new kind of audit that add "usage" notifiations every once in a while.

This allow programs like Ceilometer to consume this notifications and record
in real time the actual usage for volumes, rather than doing later.

Change-Id: I3c4b06125615ff28dca275886e4d3aaeb1c1513e
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-17 01:06:02.000000000', 'message': "When deleting an instance, avoid freakout if iscsi device is gone

It's fairly easy to get into a state where an instance is not running,
the iscsi infrastructure has been torn down, and the instance cannot
be deleted because the iscsi device cannot be successfully removed.
This patch ignores the associated return value for that scenario and
marches forward in the teardown process.

Fixes bug 1079745 (Cherry picked for Essex)

Change-Id: Ib28790892eebe341ac10a92250cf872605fefe9b
"}]
commit_message:
When deleting an instance, avoid freakout if iscsi device is gone

It's fairly easy to get into a state where an instance is not running,
the iscsi infrastructure has been torn down, and the instance cannot
be deleted because the iscsi device cannot be successfully removed.
This patch ignores the associated return value for that scenario and
marches forward in the teardown process.

Fixes bug 1079745 (Cherry picked for Essex)

Change-Id: Ib28790892eebe341ac10a92250cf872605fefe9b

commit_message:
Update the nova.conf section

Some updates to the section that documents nova.conf.

Describes the .ini format, including supported sections.

Add examples for each configuration option types.

Describe variable substitution.

Describe what to do if nova.conf is not in the standard location.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/16812

Change-Id: I8751eec2e5964b6e49ac5cb0d9a345b7fde59f9a

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-30 21:11:09.000000000', 'message': "Fix rpc control_exchange regression.

A change was made in rpc that requires project's to define the
control_exchange option themselves.  This was so the project's could
set their own default value.  This change has made it in to nova without
adding the control_exchange option, meaning that it is using the default
of 'openstack', potentially conflicting with other projects.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12518/

Fix bug 1083944.

Change-Id: Ifc00a537c4ee327cbee91fe1d911f8c402e350b7
"}]
commit_message:
Fix rpc control_exchange regression.

A change was made in rpc that requires project's to define the
control_exchange option themselves.  This was so the project's could
set their own default value.  This change has made it in to nova without
adding the control_exchange option, meaning that it is using the default
of 'openstack', potentially conflicting with other projects.

See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/12518/

Fix bug 1083944.

Change-Id: Ifc00a537c4ee327cbee91fe1d911f8c402e350b7

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-09 23:22:18.000000000', 'message': "Use connection_info on resize

During finish_migration the manager calls initialize_connection but doesn't
update the block_device_mapping with the (potentially new) connection_info
returned.

This can cause the bdm to get out of sync, the volume to fail to attach, and
the resize to fail.

fixes lp bug #1076801

Change-Id: I7591d3af8e7d592caa8811786fc5fef26e1eaf50
"}]
commit_message:
Use connection_info on resize

During finish_migration the manager calls initialize_connection but doesn't
update the block_device_mapping with the (potentially new) connection_info
returned.

This can cause the bdm to get out of sync, the volume to fail to attach, and
the resize to fail.

fixes lp bug #1076801

Change-Id: I7591d3af8e7d592caa8811786fc5fef26e1eaf50

commit_message:
Make nova/virt/* use system_metadata for flavors

This is the first in a series of patches to replace current
uses of instance['instance_type'] and some instances of
direct db.instance_type_get*() lookups with the information
now present in instance['system_metadata'].

There are a lot of seemingly-unrelated changes to the tests in
this patch. However, I believe these are necessary due to some
inconsistent use of stubbed out flavors across the board. These
should be reviewed with scrutiny.

Change-Id: Ica64b108f99f18099a64e63d65ede7c122d9c6f3

commit_message:
Use elevated cxtx in resource_tracker.resize_claim

Updates the resize_claim function in compute/resource_tracker
so that it uses an elevated context for the db.compute_node_update
call.

This fixes an issue where resizes from non-admin users would fail
to complete.

Fixes LP Bug #1085071.

Change-Id: I356e564228603834073c2b878b09cc35b88edf1e

'}, {'account_id': 1216, 'date': '2012-12-01 00:15:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

+2ing to get this in.

We might consider updating these docs further for the option of using an outbound http proxy for the outbound connectivity. This code was all written as an experiment by me to see how it'd pan out. I'm actually surprised folks are actually using it now after it languished for so long.

I'm still not really convinced this is the "best" way to do cluster synchronization. Maybe a better approach would be plop updates into a work queue and have an external program that reads from the queue and sends the synchronization data to the other cluster. This would have the advantage that the queue could be cluster internal, alleviating the connectivity issues, but the external program would need to read from said queue and any cluster data. This approach would also have the big advantage of less useless operations.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-12-01 00:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

commit_message:
Improve container-sync docs.

Two improvements: first, document that the container-sync process
connects to the remote cluster's proxy server, so outbound
connectivity is required.

Second, rewrite the behind-the-scenes container-sync example and add
some ASCII-art diagrams.

Fixes bug 1068430.

Bonus fix of docstring in wsgi.py to squelch a sphinx warning.

Change-Id: I85bd56c2bd14431e13f7c57a43852777f14014fb

[{'created': '2012-12-01 00:03:45.000000000', 'message': 'Updates tests to run in other configurations.

* Changes the reddwarf.conf.test flag so "use_nova_server_volume"
  is turned off, as it should be, and fixes a resulting fake mode bug.
* Fixes tests to not check for volume when
  "reddwarf_main_instance_has_volume" is specified in the test config.
* Changes poll_until to reuse Reddwarf implementation instead of
  rewriting it just for the tests.
* Adds tests to confirm its possible to log into a real MySQL instance.
  These are only run for "real mode" in a VM or other environment, but
  it's necessary that they live here.
* Changes the "get_address" method of the InstanceTestInfo object to
  get pulled from the test config (necessary when hitting other
  environments).
* Fixes some bugs in guest agent models.
* Deleted the pagination test. It can't run very quickly in the tox
  fake mode, so there's no point in keeping it here (it still exists
  in Reddwarf-Integration).

Change-Id: Ic9a70e9a9c3590ce975ab80970c48936dbb35040
Fixes: bug #1085188
'}]
commit_message:
Updates tests to run in other configurations.

* Changes the reddwarf.conf.test flag so "use_nova_server_volume"
  is turned off, as it should be, and fixes a resulting fake mode bug.
* Fixes tests to not check for volume when
  "reddwarf_main_instance_has_volume" is specified in the test config.
* Changes poll_until to reuse Reddwarf implementation instead of
  rewriting it just for the tests.
* Adds tests to confirm its possible to log into a real MySQL instance.
  These are only run for "real mode" in a VM or other environment, but
  it's necessary that they live here.
* Changes the "get_address" method of the InstanceTestInfo object to
  get pulled from the test config (necessary when hitting other
  environments).
* Fixes some bugs in guest agent models.
* Deleted the pagination test. It can't run very quickly in the tox
  fake mode, so there's no point in keeping it here (it still exists
  in Reddwarf-Integration).

Change-Id: Ic9a70e9a9c3590ce975ab80970c48936dbb35040
Fixes: bug #1085188

commit_message:
Fix tests when no volume is used.

This fixes tests assertions when no volume is created.

* Changes the reddwarf.conf.test flag so "use_nova_server_volume"
  is turned off, and fixes a resulting fake mode bug.
* Fixes bug in guest agent models.

Change-Id: I3a5f0ed11216f2f9e264c7f4b18625ed27e06095
Fixes: bug #1085188

[{'created': '2012-11-30 21:34:46.000000000', 'message': 'Swob bugfixes; for ? in names specifically

It was discovered that uploading items with ? in their names (encoded
with %3F of course) made Swob fail in that it trimmed off everything
after the ? as if it were a query string.

Change-Id: Ie686db9a2177aafad2e77c307ffc3f446646fbb5
'}]
commit_message:
Swob bugfixes; for ? in names specifically

It was discovered that uploading items with ? in their names (encoded
with %3F of course) made Swob fail in that it trimmed off everything
after the ? as if it were a query string.

Change-Id: Ie686db9a2177aafad2e77c307ffc3f446646fbb5

"}, {'account_id': 4, 'date': '2012-11-29 19:54:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(1 inline comment)

"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-11-29 22:15:06.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I didn't rename those files, but the stuff I left in core was the domain model. I suspect that core should be renamed domain.

each of the subsystems has a domain model (manager and driver) and a set of controllers. The controllers need to be able to talk to the domain model of the other subsystems. I could remove the controllers.py from the __init__ file, but then I end up modifying everything that was previously

from keystone import identity and from keystone import catalog
My line level comments, easier to read here:

I can change core to domain, but I don't think that answers your question.

Routes need to know about multiple controllers. Controllers need to know about multiple domain models. I am not sure which should own the top level name of the subsystem, I suspect both.

One potential solution would be to move the Manager and Driver classes into backends/core.py"}, {'account_id': 2218, 'date': '2012-11-30 22:49:19.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

Managed to change the commit id. https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17255/'}]

[{'created': '2012-11-30 15:00:07.000000000', 'message': 'Don't log stack trace on S3/EC2 client errors.

Not all configurations of OpenStack have the EC2/S3 API's
enabled. For that matter the S3 "API" in Nova (object-store)
isn't even production ready. As such it would be really nice to
hide exceptions if the S3 and EC2 clients in Tempest can't be
configured.

Change-Id: I584c79ae3f00a215d26178002c686af2ac517c7e
'}]
commit_message:
Don't log stack trace on S3/EC2 client errors.

Not all configurations of OpenStack have the EC2/S3 API's
enabled. For that matter the S3 "API" in Nova (object-store)
isn't even production ready. As such it would be really nice to
hide exceptions if the S3 and EC2 clients in Tempest can't be
configured.

commit_message:
Patch fake_libvirt_utils with fixtures.MonkeyPatch

If tests are not run in the default order nosetests runs them in it
is possible that the monkey patching of fake_libvirt utils is not
properly cleaned up. Use fixtures.MonkeyPatch to monkey patch
fake_libvirt_utils in test setUp ensuring the monkey patching is
reverted properly after each test.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Ie691cbc777c01fa8a5affa3271f36776ea9648b9

The test xenapi/vm_rrd.xml file was opened in test_xenapi.py relative to
the current working directory. This forced you to run unittests out of
the nova/tests directory. Open the xenapi/vm_rrd.xml relative to the
test_xenapi.py file so that the current working directory does not
matter.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I2b8720ea418e10e9748adaa599513794202351e6
'}]
commit_message:
Open test xenapi/vm_rrd.xml relative to tests.

The test xenapi/vm_rrd.xml file was opened in test_xenapi.py relative to
the current working directory. This forced you to run unittests out of
the nova/tests directory. Open the xenapi/vm_rrd.xml relative to the
test_xenapi.py file so that the current working directory does not
matter.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I2b8720ea418e10e9748adaa599513794202351e6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-30 21:44:13.000000000', 'message': 'Reset notifier_api before each test.

If tests are not run in the default order nosetests runs them in it
is possible that notifier_api in test_notifications.py and
test_compute_utils is in a state unsuitable for testing (notifier_api
may have had its drivers set elsewhere preventing it from picking up the
test driver). Reset the notifier_api before each test to ensure
notifier_api is usable for every test run regardless of test order.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I1f9282b96e2b2471eb8176b7ce9c95b4b1548ffe
'}]
commit_message:
Reset notifier_api before each test.

If tests are not run in the default order nosetests runs them in it
is possible that notifier_api in test_notifications.py and
test_compute_utils is in a state unsuitable for testing (notifier_api
may have had its drivers set elsewhere preventing it from picking up the
test driver). Reset the notifier_api before each test to ensure
notifier_api is usable for every test run regardless of test order.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I1f9282b96e2b2471eb8176b7ce9c95b4b1548ffe

commit_message:
Reset volume_api before cinder cloud tests.

If tests are not run in the default order nosetests runs them in it is
possible that volume_api in test_cinder_cloud.py is in a state
unsuitable for testing. Reset the volume_api before each test to ensure
volume_api is usable for every test run regardless of test order.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: I974e9eb09cbf9f19a01ecd0f13b2664291a5609e

commit_message:
Use /usr/bin/ for the metadata proxy in l3.filters

Updates the l3.filters proxy to use /usr/bin/ instead
of /usr/local/bin.  This should be a more distro friendly
default and follows the pattern used by other OpenStack
services as well.

Change-Id: I8fbaa49f97f5367c112dc399db838d204af7b4c8

commit_message:
Add --sort-key and --sort-dir to image-list

The --sort-key and --sort-dir CLI options allow users to control the
field and direction by which their images are sorted in an image-list
operation. The previous default sort behavior of sorting by ID asc has
been preserved.

Fixes bug 1082957.

Change-Id: I1d3664219c275b0379fe176f8288d6ffae0dffbe

commit_message:
add metadata support for overlapping networks

implements blueprint metadata-overlapping-networks

This is the Nova side of the changes required to support Metadata
service on overlapping Quantum networks. This change is BACKWARDS
COMPATIBLE and does not require any new configuration for Nova only
deployments.

Change-Id: I4dacd565e43e136e3faeb95184a4a2f7188415cd

commit_message:
Drop hashlib/hmac from pip-requires.

Python 2.5+ has hashlib.

Python 2.2+ has hmac.

As such there really is no need to have these in pip-requires.

Change-Id: Iaa7f6a6f2db4c5283608c320680da98ae400098f

commit_message:
Add ResellerAdmin role to ceilometer user.

For the sake of swift metering, 'ceilometer' user needs to be a
ResellerAdmin for tenant 'service'.

Change-Id: I65b3bdedddded9d5f3bac5c5d714288800ffa8b6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-20 16:14:38.000000000', 'message': 'Additional options for XenAPINFS cinder driver

Related to bp xenapi-storage-manager-nfs

Add configuration options to devstack scripts, so it is easier to set up
a system with a XenAPINFS volume backend. It makes possible to test this
configuration with exercises. The driver implementation is at:

https://review.openstack.org/15398

Change-Id: Ia214172aac377d273a03849c8cc2adcbf5b8f607
'}, {'created': '2012-11-29 12:46:48.000000000', 'message': 'Additional options for XenAPINFS cinder driver

Related to bp xenapi-storage-manager-nfs

Add configuration options to devstack scripts, so it is easier to set up
a system with a XenAPINFS volume backend. It makes possible to test this
configuration with exercises. To enable the XenAPINFS driver, specify:

CINDER_DRIVER=XenAPINFS
CINDER_XENAPI_CONNECTION_URL=<url for a xenserver>
CINDER_XENAPI_CONNECTION_USERNAME=<username for the xenserver>
CINDER_XENAPI_CONNECTION_PASSWORD=<password for the xenserver>
CINDER_XENAPI_NFS_SERVER=<a box that has an nfs export>
CINDER_XENAPI_NFS_SERVERPATH=<exported catalog>

in your localrc

Change-Id: Ia214172aac377d273a03849c8cc2adcbf5b8f607
'}]
commit_message:
Additional options for XenAPINFS cinder driver

Related to bp xenapi-storage-manager-nfs

Add configuration options to devstack scripts, so it is easier to set up
a system with a XenAPINFS volume backend. It makes possible to test this
configuration with exercises. To enable the XenAPINFS driver, specify:

CINDER_DRIVER=XenAPINFS
CINDER_XENAPI_CONNECTION_URL=<url for a xenserver>
CINDER_XENAPI_CONNECTION_USERNAME=<username for the xenserver>
CINDER_XENAPI_CONNECTION_PASSWORD=<password for the xenserver>
CINDER_XENAPI_NFS_SERVER=<a box that has an nfs export>
CINDER_XENAPI_NFS_SERVERPATH=<exported catalog>

in your localrc

Change-Id: Ia214172aac377d273a03849c8cc2adcbf5b8f607

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-30 17:37:59.000000000', 'message': "Split out part of compute's init_host.

The init_host() function in the compute manager has grown a good bit.
The amount of nesting for instance initialization was pretty deep,
making it a bit ugly.  This patch splits out the code for initializing
an instance during the service initialization and puts it into its own
function, making things a bit more readable.

Change-Id: I5183baa76304bfc04af3c7347218eefbc3dc84e3
"}]
commit_message:
Split out part of compute's init_host.

The init_host() function in the compute manager has grown a good bit.
The amount of nesting for instance initialization was pretty deep,
making it a bit ugly.  This patch splits out the code for initializing
an instance during the service initialization and puts it into its own
function, making things a bit more readable.

Change-Id: I5183baa76304bfc04af3c7347218eefbc3dc84e3

Start nova-conductor before nova-compute.

nova-compute is going to need to talk to nova-conductor during startup,
so go ahead and start it conductor before compute.

[{'created': '2012-11-30 09:00:09.000000000', 'message': 'attaching volumes will set instance_uuid instantly

This change allows the instance_uuid field to be set instantly when
beginning an attach action. The user will no longer have to wait for the
attachment to be complete to know what it is attaching to. If attaching
fails on the driver layer, we got error state and keep the instance_uuid
set for troubleshooting purposes.

blueprint instance-attached-field
Change-Id: Ie9860876ab865f766c0ae4cb616a45fd363931f8
'}]
commit_message:
attaching volumes will set instance_uuid instantly

This change allows the instance_uuid field to be set instantly when
beginning an attach action. The user will no longer have to wait for the
attachment to be complete to know what it is attaching to. If attaching
fails on the driver layer, we got error state and keep the instance_uuid
set for troubleshooting purposes.

blueprint instance-attached-field
Change-Id: Ie9860876ab865f766c0ae4cb616a45fd363931f8

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-30 14:22:08.000000000', 'message': "Ensure request_spec can be serialized.

request_spec includes some objects that must be converted to primitive
types to ensure they can be serialized by any of the rpc drivers.  In
this case, it's the volume type.  It's a sqlalchemy model.
to_primitive() will ensure that it gets converted to a dict so that it
can be serialized for messaging.

I saw this error in a smokestack log that was running tempest with qpid.
You won't see this error if you're using rabbit with the kombu driver.
We have some magic with the kombu driver that will fix these problems
automatically if they are missed.

Change-Id: I9a1b7662bca7caa2acb61d1e3879ac2654d5b32e
"}]
commit_message:
Ensure request_spec can be serialized.

request_spec includes some objects that must be converted to primitive
types to ensure they can be serialized by any of the rpc drivers.  In
this case, it's the volume type.  It's a sqlalchemy model.
to_primitive() will ensure that it gets converted to a dict so that it
can be serialized for messaging.

I saw this error in a smokestack log that was running tempest with qpid.
You won't see this error if you're using rabbit with the kombu driver.
We have some magic with the kombu driver that will fix these problems
automatically if they are missed.

Change-Id: I9a1b7662bca7caa2acb61d1e3879ac2654d5b32e

commit_message:
Use pkgutil to load cloudinit data

Unlike reading from the filesystem, this will allow the data to be read
even if the package is installed as a gzipped tarball.

Change-Id: I1972f2b6a1b6cee12521480ed774468bb3444780
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Use module names as logger names

Automatically use the current module's __name__ attribute as the name for
its logger, instead of hardcoding it or (worse) using __path__.

Change-Id: Ic089e0829e5fb93c3debd21e7715ee4c95f84d4c
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Automatically register engine options

Register the engine options as soon as we import something from the engine
package. This means we do not need to explicitly do it in all of the unit
tests.

Change-Id: I8fb0c8665d0e0255521e21a6aac223ad1e3b1b25
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move db crypto code out of the engine

Move it to heat.common instead, and change the module name to better
reflect what it does.

Change-Id: I14a8cdcea8e16607f10464e07fcab3da4f01fe10
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
add metadata proxy support for Quantum Networks

blueprint metadata-overlapping-networks

Adds Metadata for guest VMs running on Qunatum networks.  This requires
a companion patchset for Nova to test.

Change-Id: I524c6fdcd6a44e46da08395fd84c1288052a69ea

commit_message:
Create a new heat.rpc package

The definition of the RPC API is common between the engine (server) and the
clients, so move the client and common definitions out of the heat.engine
package.

Change-Id: I5fd2ba26f09c86ba1adecab4f9e06e69a694fe90
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

This is used mostly by the API (but also the engine for composed
templates), so it doesn't belong in the engine package.

Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-30 12:22:02.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_migrations for postgres

Fix creating .pgpass file that is used to connect to postgress database without
password prompt.

Fix command that execute SQL in postgres DB:
a) there were no spaces between command options and values
b) we can't drop database while we are connected to it. There is a special
database `template1` in postgres for dropping databases.
c) using `'` instead of `"` in bash to quote SQL expressions because bash
interprets only text in single quotes as plain string.

Remove SQL requests which lock database

Fix stripping password, so it works not only when password contains only
spaces.

Change-Id: I753a044aba8579b0f4225b4e67163d046ec1a32e
'}, {'created': '2012-11-30 12:49:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix test_migrations for postgres

Fix creating .pgpass file that is used to connect to postgress database without
password prompt.

Fix command that execute SQL in postgres DB:
a) there were no spaces between command options and values
b) we can't drop database while we are connected to it. There is a special
database `template1` in postgres for dropping databases.
c) using `'` instead of `"` in bash to quote SQL expressions because bash
interprets only text in single quotes as plain string.

Remove SQL requests which lock database

Fix stripping password, so it works not only when password contains only
spaces.

Change-Id: I753a044aba8579b0f4225b4e67163d046ec1a32e
'}]
commit_message:
Fix test_migrations for postgres

Fix creating .pgpass file that is used to connect to postgress database without
password prompt.

Fix command that execute SQL in postgres DB:
a) there were no spaces between command options and values
b) we can't drop database while we are connected to it. There is a special
database `template1` in postgres for dropping databases.
c) using `'` instead of `"` in bash to quote SQL expressions because bash
interprets only text in single quotes as plain string.

Remove SQL requests which lock database

Fix stripping password, so it works not only when password contains only
spaces.

Change-Id: I753a044aba8579b0f4225b4e67163d046ec1a32e

commit_message:

"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-13 21:38:33.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Ok chatted a bit about this. This is going to make this and related patches a bit more difficult, but we want to make sure that the os-cloudpipe interface does not change. This means we need to leave the os-cloudpipe extension the same, but add a new extension called os-cloudpipe-update. This can extend the /os-cloudpipe/ resource by adding an update method. I believe we have support in our extension model to make this work, but you will have to give it a try and see.

I recognize this is annoying but it saves us from having to put in a bunch of infrastructure for versioning extensions.'}, {'account_id': 5292, 'date': '2012-11-16 01:38:43.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-16 02:04:44.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

commit_message:
Add vpn ip/port setting support for CloudPipe

This extends the cloudpipe REST API to allow the setting of the IP and port
for the VPN for each network in the project

/v2/{tenant_id/os-cloudpipe/configure-project # POST ip/port

This forms part of the work to provide APIs for functionality currently
implemented by nova-manage that needs direct db access so nova-manage
can eventually be removed

DocImpact
Implements: blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

Change-Id: I416c0bfbe1c88470638f1c2004d1dcaeb51a6c41

commit_message:
Add Ec2Signer utility class to keystoneclient

Add Ec2Signer class (from keystone.utils) to keystoneclient
Allows clients to more easily generate correctly signed requests
for use with APIs using EC2 auth-extension based authentication

blueprint ec2signer-to-keystoneclient
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

Change-Id: Iea69ccd4dadd09740f42d907bf14f61c1750596a

commit_message:
Add POWERVM_STARTING state to powervm driver

In current implementation in powervm driver, the 'Starting' state
of an instance is not supported. This patch adds this to the powervm
driver and allows execution to continue until the instance is in a
'Running' state instead of failing out.

This patch fixes Bug #1084641

blueprint powervm-compute-enhancements

Change-Id: Ieb17b215547e77ee8d13b18496ba4090fc45757b

commit_message:
Implement object store metering

 Implements these pollsters for swift :
  - storage.objects (per-tenant number of objects)
  - storage.objects.size (per-tenant total size of stored objects)
  - storage.objects.containers (per-tenant number of containers)

Implements: blueprint pollster-swift
Fixes: bug #1004450
Change-Id: Ie27abd0b5803043f06899f14b394f2a7ab691bca

We no longer use instances of either class, allowing us to be confident if we
are dealing with a string rather than a string OR UUID/IPAddr instance.

Change-Id: I602e9f2e6bc63d692b4dfc0bcffd30b923286576

commit_message:
Fix inconsistencies in use of IPAddr and UUID instances.

We no longer use instances of either class, allowing us to be confident if we
are dealing with a string rather than a string OR UUID/IPAddr instance.

Change-Id: I602e9f2e6bc63d692b4dfc0bcffd30b923286576

Thanks David for reviewing.
To validate that the quotas are actually enforced, I will add the tests that are described in https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1034453 into this branch. 
Daryl, waiting for your views to conclude on the default quota set being hardcoded or set in config file (in case nova decides to change it's default quotas).
Tests that update quota set will need their quota dicts defined within themselves though."}, {'account_id': 4120, 'date': '2012-08-29 15:34:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-08-29 16:10:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Adds a Quotas client for Nova

* Adds a client for the 'os-quota-sets' extension
* Adds basic Admin and non-admin tests for GET and PUT operations for the
Quotas API
* Adds some tests to check Quota enforcement for create server (bug 1034453)

Fixes LP Bug #1040760
Fixes LP Bug #1034453
Change-Id: I7eb0041dbc80d8733bb2df54e4fc4755cfe9ae9c

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-30 06:37:04.000000000', 'message': "Make Impl of mongodb and sqlalchemy consistent

SqlAlchemy connection inherits from base.Connection, which doesn't have session
parameter in its function get_resources(). And session of get_resources() in
SqlAlchemy is not used and it can be got from self.session. So remove it to make
them consistent.

Change-Id: I85d5094d53af3de40645fa828d73d1dbc2677f0b
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>
"}]
commit_message:
Make Impl of mongodb and sqlalchemy consistent

SqlAlchemy connection inherits from base.Connection, which doesn't have session
parameter in its function get_resources(). And session of get_resources() in
SqlAlchemy is not used and it can be got from self.session. So remove it to make
them consistent.

Change-Id: I85d5094d53af3de40645fa828d73d1dbc2677f0b
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Access DB values as dict not as attributes. Part 2

We cannot assume nova.db.api will be returning sqlalchemy objects with
attributes, instead treat return values as dicts

Part of blueprint db-api-cleanup

Change-Id: I39ccd2f110c258d69bb2d4d7078c672c6a6ef36e

commit_message:
Update metadata for PyPI registration

Add trove classifiers and a download URL to setup.py
to complete the data needed to register the project
on PyPI.

Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Remove heat-metadata service

Remove heat-metadata service, since the last remaining function
(waitcondition handle notification) is now handled via the CFN
API

blueprint metsrv-remove
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
Change-Id: Ie36c86ce86f6c47e8d9f8accf8ec17084fb8cffd

I had proposed at the summit, that Ben or Rob seek feed-back via the Mailing List on this and I still think that would be appropriate.  My personal view is still that it is not within the scope of Cinder, but I'd like to elicit feed-back from a broader audience."}, {'account_id': 2417, 'date': '2012-11-20 21:50:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

John, I did send out a message last week to the Mail List soliciting feedback/discussion and so far I've gotten a few responses in private, but nothing on the public thread. I'm thinking that the mail list is a pretty noisy channel and many people probably don't read every message (I know I don't)."}, {'account_id': 428, 'date': '2012-11-21 15:18:41.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

Per feedback from the operator community this looks to be a welcome enhancement to OpenStack.  Since Cinder already does the vast majority of what's necessary to avail this capability it appears to be the logical home."}, {'account_id': 2243, 'date': '2012-11-22 06:11:13.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

So if we go forward with putting this in cinder, my preference would be to abstract it out a bit more, so for use the existing volume API a bit better without introducing the confusion/maintenance of two distinct types of create.  In other words treat it more like a back-end driver, using volume_type perhaps?  As I suggested at the Summit, extensions could be utilized for some of the gaps.

I'll have to think through it a bit more, but it would help with at least some of my concerns."}, {'account_id': 5538, 'date': '2012-11-22 06:35:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

Working on suggestions/improvements.'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-30 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

subject: Fix a leak in cpu utilization calculation
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-22 07:31:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16729/1/check/gate-ceilometer-merge/779 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16729/1/check/gate-ceilometer-pep8/774 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16729/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python26/774 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16729/1/check/gate-ceilometer-python27/776 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2012-11-22 08:59:10.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4573, 'date': '2012-11-22 09:16:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Thanks for review.'}, {'account_id': 4491, 'date': '2012-11-22 09:18:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

(1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-11-22 14:43:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Thanks for the patch,

The reason I didn't do something similar in the first place is that I we don't see CPU times for suspended (but not deleted) instances.

However on reflection, this may not be a huge issue.

The instance CPU timer is reset on resume, in which case there are two possibilities:

1. curr time < prev time
Most likely if the polling period is reasonably short and the instance was running for a reasonable period pre-suspend. In this case, we calculate CPU util on the basis of curr time (and ignore prev time as this is stale).

2. curr time >= prev time 
Possible if the polling period is long and/or the instance was running for a very short period pre-suspend. In this case we calculate CPU util on the basis of curr time - prev time.

With the new reaping logic in place, the CPU util would be reported as 0.0% on the first polling cycle, whereas previously we would have had one additional realistic sample in case #1 (and the possibility of an under-reading in case #2).

Given that the under-reading is a realistic possibility under the old logic, I could buy this approach. However, it does seem OTT to sanitize the map on every single call to get_cpu_util() -  could this be done instead on a subset of calls?

Cheers,
Eoghan"}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-30 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-30 06:03:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 07:28:13.000000000', 'message': 'Fix a leak in cpu utilization calculation

Currently an instance usage information is kept in a dictionary
and this dictionary is never cleaned, even when the instance is
deleted.

Add a hack to remove the dictionary item if not update for more
than 5 interval. This is a bit hacky, but supposed work now. Possibly
we need the instance life cycle information in the agent.

Also remove the usage of datetime, and always use timeutils functionality.

Change-Id: I893274dfdf2e8800f333500813b6845eb021f120
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Fix a leak in cpu utilization calculation

Currently an instance usage information is kept in a dictionary
and this dictionary is never cleaned, even when the instance is
deleted.

Add a hack to remove the dictionary item if not update for more
than 5 interval. This is a bit hacky, but supposed work now. Possibly
we need the instance life cycle information in the agent.

Also remove the usage of datetime, and always use timeutils functionality.

Change-Id: I893274dfdf2e8800f333500813b6845eb021f120
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Fix bug for sql identity authenticate.

Fixes bug 1079013.

Currently, sql backend of identity uses None as the default value of
tenant_ref in authenticate() method. But all other keytone codes treat
tenant as a dictionary, so this would trigger exception in some cases
(such as user-role-add). This patch fixes this problem by changing
tenant_ref default value to empty dictionary instead of None.

Change-Id: I2c04f258bff63389c65b945831e6a2f5778b8053

[{'created': '2012-11-26 11:14:53.000000000', 'message': "Fixed image not getting deleted from cache.

When an image is being added to cache and a DELETE request for same
image arrives, the image remains in the 'cache' directory forever.
Also, admin user is able to download such image. Cleaned up the
deleted image from cache to resolve the issue permanently.

commit_message:
Fixed image not getting deleted from cache.

When an image is being added to cache and a DELETE request for same
image arrives, the image remains in the 'cache' directory forever.
Also, admin user is able to download such image. Cleaned up the
deleted image from cache to resolve the issue permanently.

Fixes LP: #1083070

Change-Id: Id2b11d21b8ccecb1037eb6341ffd24a3c2e1833c

commit_message:
use libvirt getInfo() to receive number of physical CPUs

multiprocessing.cpu_count() reports the wrong number of
physical CPUs on a Xen dom0 system. Because we're inside
the libvirt virtualization driver the corresponding
libvirt method (getInfo()) should be used instead.

fixes bug 1084611

Change-Id: Ida4be889ce98c7a6f58564a8bc295b360ff65965

commit_message:
Enable debug in run_tests using pdb

    When you try to debug some test using nose.tools.set_trace the pdb prompt
is 'trapped' inside tee manipulation of stdout.
    Since debug mode is not supposed to be used in the gates we don't need to
concern about the lack of a log to analyze the output.

Change-Id: I7daebe7267b04d41f2ca383f826419f0dfb544ab

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-29 23:22:01.000000000', 'message': "Fixes another fake mode eventlet bug.

The code to spawn an event in zero seconds used to call the function
instantly, but now doesn't. This causes an issue in a VM when eventlet
is used.

Change-Id: Icda777a20743531fd26f5f14d2c838ef10bcfd40
Fixes: bug #1084144
"}]
commit_message:
Fixes another fake mode eventlet bug.

The code to spawn an event in zero seconds used to call the function
instantly, but now doesn't. This causes an issue in a VM when eventlet
is used.

Change-Id: Icda777a20743531fd26f5f14d2c838ef10bcfd40
Fixes: bug #1084144

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-29 23:11:53.000000000', 'message': 'Change validation to require non-blank name for instances.

* Added validation to make sure the name is not blank during
  instance creation.
* Added test to verify that instance creation fails with no name.
* Added test to verify that instance creation fails when instance
  name only has spaces.

Change-Id: I6feca6d862f37b20eafbe29f9391457c3367bff3
Fixes: bug #1084720
'}]
commit_message:
Change validation to require non-blank name for instances.

* Added validation to make sure the name is not blank during
  instance creation.
* Added test to verify that instance creation fails with no name.
* Added test to verify that instance creation fails when instance
  name only has spaces.

Change-Id: I6feca6d862f37b20eafbe29f9391457c3367bff3
Fixes: bug #1084720

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-29 04:33:37.000000000', 'message': 'Provide i18n to those messages without _()

bug 1081498

There are a few log messages without _(), but a lot messages with _().
Wrap these log messages with _() in order to make the code consistent.

fix missing imports for _

Pass the log message and interpolation argument(s) to the logger separately

remove extra parens

rework the patch against latest trunk

Change-Id: Ib0a7b0f9c57aadfbc2cfc477c6123b885c9c6060
'}]
commit_message:
Provide i18n to those messages without _()

bug 1081498

There are a few log messages without _(), but a lot messages with _().
Wrap these log messages with _() in order to make the code consistent.

fix missing imports for _

Pass the log message and interpolation argument(s) to the logger separately

remove extra parens

rework the patch against latest trunk

Change-Id: Ib0a7b0f9c57aadfbc2cfc477c6123b885c9c6060

commit_message:
heat engine : Convert WaitConditionHandle to pre-signed URLs

Change WaitConditionHandle so it provides a pre-signed URL which
allows authenticated wait condition notification via the CFN API

blueprint metsrv-remove
Change-Id: I5c1c3a17ade35c810e49b1f27d80bcfea9e89485
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

commit_message:
heat engine : subclass keystone client to encapsulate common code

Encapsulate the keystone client in a heat-specific wrapper subclass
so we can put heat-specific implementation related to keystone in
one place.  This will allow easier reuse of common code between
resources which need to manipulate stack users and ec2 keys

blueprint metsrv-remove
Change-Id: I3d9751023c52cb75ab5e1f62415b1db4e4361dec
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

I've asked Vish to cut a new novaclient release, but I've also got a superseding patch against novaclient under review which will make the flavorid argument to novaclient optional:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/16488/

I'm not a fan of the "auto" string, and would rather see this patch updated to simply not pass the id to novaclient at all once that review is merged. So if you could fix that here that'd be lovely...

The two test cases there were legacy and shouldn't have been in there/shouldn't have passed. Thanks for fixing those.

Change the type of flavor_id hidden field in EditFlavor form
from IntegerField to CharField since flavor id is a string
representation of UUID now. Additionally change the type of
similar hidden fields in CreateExtraSpec and EditExtraSpec forms.

Remove flavor id generation code from form handling code. Id generation
should be done only in corresponding OpenStack components (nova, etc.).
Nova client now supports flavor id autogeneration (flavorid must be None

underlying nova client.

Change test data flavor ids from strings containing integers
to UUID-like strings to make them correspond to real data.

Update flavor tests to make them compatible with new
api.nova.flavor_create() signature.

Remove conversions of flavor id to int from all tests. In particular,
update test_index_flavor_get_exception() to make it generate unique
UUID flavor ids instead of integers.

Fixes bug #1076761

commit_message:
Fix handling of UUID-typed flavor ids

Change the type of flavor_id hidden field in EditFlavor form
from IntegerField to CharField since flavor id is a string
representation of UUID now. Additionally change the type of
similar hidden fields in CreateExtraSpec and EditExtraSpec forms.

Remove flavor id generation from form handling code. Id generation
should be done only in corresponding OpenStack components (nova, etc.).
Since nova supports flavor id autogeneration and 'flavorid' parameter
of FlavorManager.create() in novaclient is optional, remove 'flavorid'
parameter from api.nova.flavor_create().

Change flavor ids in test data from strings containing integers
to UUID-like strings to make them correspond to real data.

Update flavor tests to make them compatible with new
api.nova.flavor_create() signature.

Remove conversions of flavor id to int from all tests. In particular,
update test_index_flavor_get_exception() to make it generate unique
UUID flavor ids instead of integers.

Fixes bug #1076761

Change-Id: Iaa308578981f0379ff61a9dd42620eaf0ab1d605

The reason this was happening is only nova.tests was being imported which pulls in the contents of nova/tests/__init__.py. That __init__.py did not import the contents of nova.tests.utils so it is necessary when running the test on its own to import nova.tests.utils.

This was passing when all tests are run because some other test was importing nova.tests.utils and making the is_osx() function available when the tests in this change ran.'}]

[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-29 02:47:48.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/17097/1/check/gate-nova-merge/13159 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/17097/1/check/gate-nova-pylint/3701 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 5638, 'date': '2012-11-29 04:38:17.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-11-29 10:15:03.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Hmm this will work but it's a bit hacky and probably doesn't handle all cases. This issue at hand is that the test assumes MD5 hashing is available. What you could do is in nova/virt/disk/api.py split out this from _set_passwd():

def _enc_passwd(passwd):
    if os.name == 'nt':
        raise exception.NovaException(_('Not implemented on Windows'))
    # encryption algo - id pairs for crypt()
    algos = {'SHA-512': '$6$', 'SHA-256': '$5$', 'MD5': '$1$', 'DES': ''}

    salt = _generate_salt()

    # crypt() depends on the underlying libc, and may not support all
    # forms of hash. We try md5 first. If we get only 13 characters back,
    # then the underlying crypt() didn't understand the '$n$salt' magic,
    # so we fall back to DES.
    # md5 is the default because it's widely supported. Although the
    # local crypt() might support stronger SHA, the target instance
    # might not.
    encrypted_passwd = crypt.crypt(admin_passwd, algos['MD5'] + salt)
    if len(encrypted_passwd) == 13:
        encrypted_passwd = crypt.crypt(admin_passwd, algos['DES'] + salt)

    return encrytped_passwd

And call that function from the test, to generate the appropriate hash. I also notice that an exception is
thrown on 'nt' so I suppose the test should handle that case too."}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-11-29 18:49:47.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-29 20:18:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-29 20:19:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

updated based on p-draigbrady's feedback.  test now works on OSX"}, {'account_id': 209, 'date': '2012-11-29 20:35:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1812, 'date': '2012-11-29 20:36:20.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Thanks. Seems you included another file in the patch though?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-29 20:38:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Fix test_inject_admin_password for OSX

On OSX DES is used instead of MD5, see
nova.virt.disk.api:_set_password for more details

Fix bug 1084337

Change-Id: I2490e1e322d42fecb43af5436fea2f903c11e265

commit_message:
Add domain proxies that do policy.enforce checks

This patch introduces domain objects that handle all the policy.enforce
checks. In this way, eventually the controller will not have to keep
track of enforcing authorization policies.

Part of implementing bp:glance-domain-logic-layer

Change-Id: Ide724f5b246e50fbdb8ee7617359e1aa97bdb2ee

commit_message:
make the DHCP agent use a unique queue name

fixes bug: 1084621

This generates a unique name, so that multiple agents can be active
within a deployment.

Change-Id: Ia2bdc27866e6aa4aebd0bd28d1dfd25c3167dd03

commit_message:
Process engine config before initialisation

Don't import the heat-engine service module until the configuration options
have been initialised. This will allow us to read the configuration during
initialisation of the engine.

Change-Id: I2bc70d903434eac1fa248640018f038c5ef2bead
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

I like that it will allow dns for a network to work across all compute nodes but it seems like it also makes sense to include the tenant_name in the host record (instance_name.tenant_name.novalocal) to minimize dns collisions as well. '}, {'account_id': 2750, 'date': '2012-11-27 21:51:44.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11:

conceptually this seems a bit problematic to try to create our own distributed DNS system inside nova-network. If a compute node misses an update (is offline) doesn't this cause a pretty big synchronization issue?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-27 22:09:27.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 11: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is looking much better!

Sean: The host files are regenerated when the service starts so missing an update due to the host being down shouldn't be an issue. It is possible that due to some failure that a dns entry could get out of sync on one of the hosts, but it should only affect vms on that host until another update is called.

Design wise this feature seems ok to me, although I am concerned about the potential performance impact of turning it on. I think an active single network with a bunch of hosts will very quickly run into scaling limits because all of those hosts will be hitting the database simultaneously. It seems like we should be wrapping it in a config option that is disabled by default."}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2012-11-28 10:35:55.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 12.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-28 10:55:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 12: Works for me

https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2012-11-28 18:05:21.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 13.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-28 18:13:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Do not merge

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-28 18:15:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Another thought: It might be nice to make that dns option configurable:

dns_strategy='none', 'fanout', 'periodic'

none = don't update
fanout = update via cast at launch and terminate (benefit is fast update, good for small networks
periodic = update via a periodic task (every 5 minutes or something).

I think the periodic update will be much better for large installs. Alternatively, this could be a separate patch with its own config option.
dns_update_periodic_interval=0 (by default)

Vish"}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-28 18:24:08.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 13: Works for me

- http://logs.openstack.org/16153/13/check/gate-nova-pylint/3666 : SUCCESS (non-voting)
'}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2012-11-28 18:47:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13:

Yes, it is a nice thought.

But if it's periodic, a new DNS entry will not be available until the periodic task was ran. It will be annoying for PaaS deployments for example.

We can let this patch like this to correct this bug and perhaps, we can backport it to Folsom.
We could create a separate patch with config option for Grizzly ?"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-28 19:19:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 13: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

commit_message:
Multi host DHCP networking and local DNS resolving

Configure all dnsmasq instances to use the hosts file instead of the
default local file '/etc/host' when the network is configured in
'multi_host' mode.

This hosts file contains all DNS entries of the network and it is
replicated on all host where a 'nova-network' daemon is instantiated.
There is a hosts file for each networks.

It needs to add a new network API to update the host file on all
network hosts.

When a network host is called to (de)allocate a VM, it (de)allocate the
instance fixed IP adress(es) on the concerned network host and when it's
done, it calls all networks to update their DNS db entries if it's
needed through a fanout cast.

DocImpact: new config options
Fixes LP bug #1078808

Change-Id: I5c13bd895ebd31f276eb14e996025ddcfb67c3d9

commit_message:
Accepts UUID as an ID of Floating IP

Fixes bug 1052561.

In Quanutm, Floating IPs are identified by UUID instead of integer ID.
After quantum-nova integration for FLoating IP has been implemented,
Horizon also needs to accept UUID style of ID for Floating IP.

Change-Id: I6ed919cbbc818c97cecef2fe3a91c8e5a7ac76e0

commit_message:
enable mod_wsgi on horizon_init

on a clean ubuntu environment wsgi wasn't getting enabled
ensure that it actually turns on wsgi to that apache can start

Change-Id: I9c74f7c5d5d2f995843b2a649a52f7159c7de314

subject: Ignore the socket timeout error in Selenium test
messages:
[{'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2012-11-26 15:22:45.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I don't know where the socket timeout comes from and why it doesn't happen everywhere. This patch seems to fix it on VMs where I saw it happen consistently like it's doing on CI at the moment (the test passes just fine after swallowing the exception).

I can also submit a patch to remove the test that keeps failing until the issue is better understood (advice welcome!)"}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2012-11-26 15:46:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

recheck'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-26 16:00:37.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Great, thank you. Any progress in making selenium tests more robust is greatly appreciated.'}, {'account_id': 6237, 'date': '2012-11-28 09:08:21.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

WebDriverWait() has 'ignored_exceptions' optional argument. I would prefer you use that instead of writing your own ad-hoc method. Also it would be good if you ignore only 'socket.timeout' exceptions instead of all exceptions."}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2012-11-28 14:38:55.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Very nice, I wasn't aware of that argument - thanks izbyshev! I wonder if it would be helpful to keep the helper method around if we need to watch out for socket timeouts every time we wait for an element, though I'll remove it for now."}, {'account_id': 4978, 'date': '2012-11-28 14:52:09.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-28 15:10:41.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
RetryFilter checks 'node' as well as 'host'

FilterScheduler and RetryFilter use "(host, node)" instead of "host" to
filter candidates. It makes rescheduling on different nodes in the same
host possible.

Fix bug 1081370

Change-Id: Id51b262de7b47b5f9215463eca5ae07a29109c3f

commit_message:
Add aggregate_host_add and _delete to conductor.

Offload the db writes for adding and removing a host to or from
a host aggregate to the conductor service.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I7c3da2d5c9fc6d7e72fb9371b7ea6a2b10c5218d

commit_message:
v2 API image upload set image status to active

For v2 API, updated the image status to 'active' after the image
data is uploaded.

Fixes LP: #1034787.

Change-Id: Ia689b841c36ce203e9f2858b79160a2d16154f52

rather than strings.

commit_message:
Validate that rxtx_factor is a float.

Nova stores rxtx_factor as a float internally and as such
novaclient should validate that a float is specified
when creating a flavor.

Fixes LP Bug #1083651.

Change-Id: I75f9440d3fe2a0e72ea592f2259640623400ae73

commit_message:
Adds nova client support for nova-manage vpn command

Adds "nova cloudpipe-configure" command
Adds shell tests for cloudpipe-list and cloudpipe-create commands which
already exist

This patch depends on https://review.openstack.org/#/c/15854/

Change-Id: I784f5bf0f25a2d8cae4b7c2c6ccf345842ffe352
Implements: blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

Adds the following commands:
- "fixed-ip-get <ip_addr>" - displays information about the fixed ip ip_addr
- "fixed-ip-reserve <ip_addr>" - reserves the fixed ip ip_addr
- "fixed-ip-unreserve <ip_addr>" - unreserves the fixed ip ip_addr

Change-Id: I6a5c8b9f7ab359adeb57b86240279649cd421801
Implements: blueprint apis-for-nova-manage
'}]
commit_message:
Adds nova client support for nova-manage fixed command

Adds the following commands:
- "fixed-ip-get <ip_addr>" - displays information about the fixed ip ip_addr
- "fixed-ip-reserve <ip_addr>" - reserves the fixed ip ip_addr
- "fixed-ip-unreserve <ip_addr>" - unreserves the fixed ip ip_addr

Change-Id: I6a5c8b9f7ab359adeb57b86240279649cd421801
Implements: blueprint apis-for-nova-manage

Methods:

* get(server object or id) - perform fping for single instance

Change-Id: Ic3eda142781d1a14f2cfc83626672a579fc93a7d

commit_message:
Implement fping calls in nova client

Implements blueprint novaclient-fping

Provide fping API calls in nova client as well as unit tests. API is
accessed by `fping` field of nova client.
Methods:
* list(all_tenants=False|True, include=[VM ids], exclude=[VM ids]) -
  perform fping for all VMs in current project (or all projects if
  all_tenants==True)
* get(server object or id) - perform fping for single instance

Change-Id: Ic3eda142781d1a14f2cfc83626672a579fc93a7d

commit_message:
heat api : add waitcondition to cfn api

Add a new path to the CFN api, which implements CFN style waitcondition
notification - this means we can move away from the separate heat-metadata
service for this purpose, instead using the authenticated CFN API

blueprint metsrv-remove
Change-Id: I62cff7cb4c7a009fea2c8f62ea446d8d758f5429
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-11-29 16:58:11.000000000', 'message': "Enable debug in run_tests using pdb

    When you try to debug some test using nose.tools.set_trace the pdb prompt
is 'trapped' inside tee manipulation of stdout.
    Since debug mode is not supposed to be used in the gates we don't need to
concern about the lack of a log to analyze the output.

    Change-Id: I7daebe7267b04d41f2ca383f826419f0dfb544ab

Change-Id: Ib4d5c0f8c24375f1895d43409b9bd28d215ac56d
"}]
commit_message:
Enable debug in run_tests using pdb

    When you try to debug some test using nose.tools.set_trace the pdb prompt
is 'trapped' inside tee manipulation of stdout.
    Since debug mode is not supposed to be used in the gates we don't need to
concern about the lack of a log to analyze the output.

    Change-Id: I7daebe7267b04d41f2ca383f826419f0dfb544ab

Change-Id: Ib4d5c0f8c24375f1895d43409b9bd28d215ac56d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 18:34:39.000000000', 'message': "Fix HostDeserializer to enable multiple line xml

Fixes bug: 1082132

The current HostDeserializer wasn't able to deal with multiple line xml inputs.
Since the HostDeserializer is used only on the update operation this patch
renames it to HostUpdateDeserializer, and parses only the valid options (status
and maintenance_mode).

Change-Id: I9ec3b296a07e0fc903da1c005cf7bd5dcb08fd1b
"}]
commit_message:
Fix HostDeserializer to enable multiple line xml

Fixes bug: 1082132

The current HostDeserializer wasn't able to deal with multiple line xml inputs.
Since the HostDeserializer is used only on the update operation this patch
renames it to HostUpdateDeserializer, and parses only the valid options (status
and maintenance_mode).

Change-Id: I9ec3b296a07e0fc903da1c005cf7bd5dcb08fd1b

commit_message:
Fix args to AggregateError exception.

This patch adds some arguments to the AggregateError exception when
raised from a test.  This didn't actually break the test, but it threw
me off for a little bit.  I had done something to break this test, so
when I went to look at why, there was an exception logged because of this
mistake, which wasn't related to what the real problem was.  To avoid
this unnecessarily making it into the test log, pass some stuff so that
building the exception message succeeds.

Change-Id: I4460f4844c16877ef78b363842518b0ba96eb9aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-21 22:29:41.000000000', 'message': 'Remove start_guests_on_host_boot config option

Fixes bug 1081808

The start_guests_on_host_boot config option ignores any/all
user-requested VM state and attempts to start every VM assigned to the
hypervisor in question. This means even a VM which was suspended,
paused, in error state, etc will run through the process of attempting
to start. resume_guests_state_on_host_boot provides similar
functionality, except that it confirms the VM was previously in a
running state prior to attempting to restart on compute startup.

This patch will remove the config option entirely.

Change-Id: Ib26e74c46e17496bccf8e6fa3002fc4c78bde9e9

commit_message:
Remove start_guests_on_host_boot config option

Fixes bug 1081808

The start_guests_on_host_boot config option ignores any/all
user-requested VM state and attempts to start every VM assigned to the
hypervisor in question. This means even a VM which was suspended,
paused, in error state, etc will run through the process of attempting
to start. resume_guests_state_on_host_boot provides similar
functionality, except that it confirms the VM was previously in a
running state prior to attempting to restart on compute startup.

This patch will remove the config option entirely.

Flags: DocImpact
Change-Id: Ib26e74c46e17496bccf8e6fa3002fc4c78bde9e9

commit_message:
Use Service thread group for WSGI request handling

- Reuse the pool from thread group in service.Service
  instead of creating a new green pool
- Add ability to control the size of the pool in service.Service
- Add a couple of tests for wsgi.Service() to test the size
  of pool a start/stop as well
- Get rid of the wait method by using tg.add_thread
- Get rid of pool in wsgi.Service
- Added explicit property for host and port

Fixes LP #1050379

Change-Id: I40507dc7887fb036ec594bb167cdaa42c278607e

Change-Id: Ic3e41a546c0d1b7b6aae04e1dbac2933ac661f57

commit_message:
Hide the GroupAttr conf and group attributes

There's no reason why an option group shouldn't have options called
'group' or 'conf'.

Add a test case which would have failed because the 'conf' attribute
would have been a ConfigOpts instance and fix it by making those
attributes private.

Change-Id: Ic3e41a546c0d1b7b6aae04e1dbac2933ac661f57

commit_message:
Don't run the periodic task if ticks_between_runs is below zero

if the user sets say image_cache_manager_interval=-1, then
don't add the task to the list of periodic tasks

remove extra braces that i had added

DocImpact

Fixes LP #1084232

Change-Id: Ieecd67ddbc70b815a88f40e72ca2899787d75988

'}, {'created': '2012-11-26 07:02:45.000000000', 'message': 'Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments

commit_message:
Fix regression with cfg CLI arguments

Fixes bug #1082279

Only options registered using register_cli_opt() should be available via
the CLI, but since e42276a all options are added to the CLI.

Also modify one of the existing unit tests to catch this problem.

Change-Id: I742a4ae4e0fc17cd9ae5e4424c2edd38e2bc50a2

commit_message:
Access DB values as dict not as attributes

We cannot assume nova.db.api will be returning sqlalchemy objects with
attributes, instead treat return values as dicts

Part of blueprint db-api-cleanup

Change-Id: Icb955118aabff1d8f9ee7c3e95f8f2b3ffc671ee

Fixing wrong reference to rabbit_user

not rabbit_user, as was in there previous

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-23 11:46:56.000000000', 'message': 'Fix broken --help with CommonConfigOpts

Since we switched to argparse, the way help strings are interpolated
have changed and broken --help with the options registered by
CommonConfigOpts.

Fix and add a new test case which would catch the issue.

Change-Id: I10e42efe4721e22ff41d0efbf390c805ccb9a6a0
'}]
commit_message:
Fix broken --help with CommonConfigOpts

Since we switched to argparse, the way help strings are interpolated
have changed and broken --help with the options registered by
CommonConfigOpts.

Fix and add a new test case which would catch the issue.

Change-Id: I10e42efe4721e22ff41d0efbf390c805ccb9a6a0

commit_message:
Lookup the class for an Instance in Autoscaling

Instead of hardcoding the class for handling instances in autoscaling,
look up the class for the AWS::EC2::Instance resource type using the same
mechanism used for creating resources normally.

Change-Id: I37b9aff9a83b89cdc782467720970a04549d7b1e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Load resources dynamically

Automatically load all resources as "plugins" when importing the package
heat.engine.resources, instead of having to list them explicitly.

Change-Id: I9d11ab9a5b1dd21bc5f9c2f0aad95c035a9c9aa0
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>
