'}, {'account_id': 4257, 'date': '2012-11-29 10:55:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

I haven't looked at stevedore in depth, but I think the issue with it will be that at our built-in resources are referring to each other (e.g. stuff inheriting from resources.stack.Stack), and are being referred to directly from unit tests. I'm guessing that stevedore is going to expect plugins to be independent and will only expose their entry points.

I could look into it further, but for our use case it already feels a bit like using a sledgehammer to crack a nut. Sure, we could maybe duct-tape a nutcracker to the sledgehammer; I'm just not sure that would be a better design."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-11-29 10:55:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Also no joy with stevedore?

I'd almost suggest extending stevedore to meet our
needs than adding more module loading stuff since
stevedore is supposed to be what the rest of openstack
is using for driver/module loading."}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-11-29 10:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 4715, 'date': '2012-11-29 10:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-29 10:55:05.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

test-requires, so the venv environment in tox needs to be
updated to include them.

Then the build_sphinx command looks for configuration settings
in setup.cfg, so those need to be added.

When Sphinx runs in this way, it ends up creating

commit_message:
Fixes to enable the jenkins doc job to work

Some of our documentation dependencies were not listed in
test-requires, so the venv environment in tox needs to be
updated to include them.

Then the build_sphinx command looks for configuration settings
in setup.cfg, so those need to be added.

When Sphinx runs in this way, it ends up creating
RST files for every module it finds in the source tree
so it can document the internal APIs. Those generated files
can be ignored by git.

Change-Id: I21b5f9c6c4d4201893bb3bf87f0b61a053b968f5
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Lower the minimum required version of anyjson

Nova uses anyjson 0.2.4, so reduce our minimum required
version to avoid installation conflicts.

Change-Id: I4458117a9e4968afb6b7b7e6573d77dadc36cf5b
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

commit_message:
Possible commandline and client scheme for moniker-client.

Each command needs to be enumerated in shell.py, and also enumerated
in setup.py.  Arguments for each command are automatically generated
from the associated object schema.

Change-Id: I7497a2158fe364f88b313a3002e305f1e481b6c0

commit_message:
Call plug_vifs() for all instances in init_host

Remove the assumption that we are using the "flat" networking model
and there is a single bridge interface for all instances on a given
compute node.  Instead simply call plug_vifs() for each instance in
init_host.

Fixes bug 1083784

Change-Id: I4b367deb6851c06c80a4bdf0bd806cf5e867bb0a

commit_message:
Make compute manager use conductor for instance_gets

This patch adds support to nova-conductor for the following operations:

instance_get_by_uuid()
instance_get_all_by_host()

It also makes the compute/manager use nova-conductor for those operations.

Change-Id: Ia872a2ec6061b4aac9f89366125060fc0844dc22

commit_message:
Convert datetimes for conductor instance_update.

This patch ensures that jsonutils.to_primitive() is used on the updates
being sent to conductor's instance_update method.  This is primarily so
that we convert datetimes to a string using a very specific format
defined in the timeutils module.  Then, in the conductor manager,
convert these fields back into datetime objects using timeutils.

The conversion to a string was already happening implicitly if you were
using the kombu rpc driver.  The reason is that kombu uses anyjson,
which we hook in to and will automatically use our own to_primitive()
to fix serialization problems for kombu.  Doing it explicitly is better,
and is required for the other rpc drivers to work.

This is to address a problem with sqlite where it would raise an
exception when we try to do an update to a datetime field with a string.

Fix bug 1084240.

Change-Id: I2d703a92df1e85f0f3a7a793b301fe16cbd81ff5

The call to service_get_by_host_and_topic would raise AdminRequired
in the case that a non-admin tried to disassociate a floating ip
from their instance and multi_host was on. Using an elevated
context for the db lookup enables the host lookup to happend and
allows a user to disassociate their floating ips.

Fixes bug 1074437

Change-Id: I3d47b5a48eae21ea913120bd00728a0b8132da81
(cherry picked from commit eedd98477dd3b8a5561d30732b7ccf71e9a7d428)

commit_message:
Use elevated context in disassociate_floating_ip

The call to service_get_by_host_and_topic would raise AdminRequired
in the case that a non-admin tried to disassociate a floating ip
from their instance and multi_host was on. Using an elevated
context for the db lookup enables the host lookup to happend and
allows a user to disassociate their floating ips.

Fixes bug 1074437

Change-Id: I3d47b5a48eae21ea913120bd00728a0b8132da81
(cherry picked from commit eedd98477dd3b8a5561d30732b7ccf71e9a7d428)

Adds support for the extra parameter added in the compute driver's

Change-Id: I887d48f39601323433384833f8b8d33132858b59

commit_message:
Fixes HyperV compute "resume" tests

Fixes Bug #1083018

Adds support for the extra parameter added in the compute driver's
resume method. The added network_info parameter is currently not used
and can safely be set to None.

Change-Id: I887d48f39601323433384833f8b8d33132858b59

commit_message:
Fix bug with swob.Request.path_info_pop

path_info_pop didn't behave as the webob one did with single segment
paths like /one and with root-only paths /

Now it should.

Change-Id: Ib88344de386ab9e8975e7f48c1afc47731992ee2

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-27 22:27:09.000000000', 'message': "Include 'hosts' and 'metadetails' in aggregate.

When converting an Aggregate sqlalchemy model to primitive types using
jsonutils.to_primitive(), the hosts and metadata were being left out.
This is because they are implemented as properties on the model and must
be explicitly listed as extra keys to be read.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I4048ea6f477f7a695701eb3ba57f97afca0c0e41

commit_message:
Include 'hosts' and 'metadetails' in aggregate.

When converting an Aggregate sqlalchemy model to primitive types using
jsonutils.to_primitive(), the hosts and metadata were being left out.
This is because they are implemented as properties on the model and must
be explicitly listed as extra keys to be read.

We also want to make sure that the _hosts and _metadata are eager
loaded.  This patch ensures this gets done by adding it to the
_get_aggregate_query() helper, and making sure it is used everywhere
that is appropriate.  Also, on creation of the aggregate, just manually
set _hosts and _metadata to empty lists, since we know they're empty at
this point.

These changes caused a side effect to the os-aggreages API extension.
The result from creating an aggregate started including 'hosts' and
'metadata'.  There's a hack in there to maintain the same API result.
These don't add any value to this API call anyway, since we know they're
blank at this point.

Part of blueprint no-db-compute.

Change-Id: I4048ea6f477f7a695701eb3ba57f97afca0c0e41

commit_message:
Verify doc/api_samples files along with the templates

This also includes a bunch of updates to the actual samples that have
become stale as things have changed in the tree and naughty developers
haven't updated the docs. This new bit of logic in the samples test
should help prevent that in the future.

In order to verify the static doc/api_samples files, this adds a new
method to the base test, which allows the subclasses to refine their
subs into pattern matches after the server response is verified, and
before the doc/api_samples file is verified.

Change-Id: Ie46b24a65145c407d46974b63a97a84911223547

commit_message:
Fix blocking test for nova notifier

Mock out the method of the conductor API that causes
nova to try to use the message bus to communicate
with the remote daemon. There is nothing listening
in the CI environment, so the instance_update call
hangs the tests.

Change-Id: Id95ee0d3f45ef38adadcf94981f97ab12f60f6ad
Signed-off-by: Doug Hellmann <doug.hellmann@dreamhost.com>

In case of VM migration, do we need to have the same MAC address on all interfaces which use the shared DHCP address ?'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-27 17:15:02.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6:

eduoard: Sharing the mac may help, although the dhcp ip is currently placed on br100, so we can't give it a unique mac without affecting other ips on that bridge as well. I think we might be able to do something really tricky like do some sort of mac 'natting' for dhcp packets using ebtables, but that seems a little too much to try to do in this patch.

In the real world, it isn't a huge issue that the mac address changes. When the vm tries to renew its lease it will send a packet to the old mac and fail, but it will re-arp after it doesn't receive a response.

Another potential option would be to arping for the address after a migration so hopefully the vm can update its arp tables, but I think either this or the ebtables mangling are optimisations that can be done later if the re-arp turns out to cause hiccups / delays.

Note that in my configuration I am using this with handing out a hardware gateway instead of using the local compute host as the gateway so the potential hiccups are limited to the dhcp renew. I think this is probably good enough."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2012-11-27 22:11:39.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

There are a lot of horribly broken DHCP clients out there (I'm looking at you, Windows) but I don't think the the MAC address changing will be problematic.  Either way, I agree it can be addressed with a future patch if real world use proves otherwise."}, {'account_id': 55, 'date': '2012-11-28 18:00:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 6: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-20 21:21:13.000000000', 'message': "Allow multi_host compute nodes to share dhcp ip

This adds a new flag: share_dhcp_address which if enabled in
multihost mode will allow all compute nodes to share an ip on
guest network. The code will isolate the address using iptables
and ebtables so it is only visible to the vms.

This patch has two benefits:

a) we don't have to use an ip address from every network for each
compute node. This is especially valuable in vlan mode where the
networks are generally small

b) we can improve security by blocking all access to the ip on the
guest network from outside the compute node. While we could do similar
blocking using a different ip for each node, it makes dhcp setup
much more complicated if a vm is migrated to another node.

Implements blueprint shared-dhcp-ip

Change-Id: Iaf84c0ad2848921122866956105eb44c074450dc

commit_message:
Allow multi_host compute nodes to share dhcp ip

This adds a new flag: share_dhcp_address which if enabled in
multihost mode will allow all compute nodes to share an ip on
guest network. The code will isolate the address using iptables
and ebtables so it is only visible to the vms.

This patch has two benefits:

a) we don't have to use an ip address from every network for each
compute node. This is especially valuable in vlan mode where the
networks are generally small

b) we can improve security by blocking all access to the ip on the
guest network from outside the compute node. While we could do similar
blocking using a different ip for each node, it makes dhcp setup
much more complicated if a vm is migrated to another node.

Implements blueprint shared-dhcp-ip

Change-Id: Iaf84c0ad2848921122866956105eb44c074450dc

[{'created': '2012-11-19 21:52:05.000000000', 'message': 'Prototype of a baremetal specific rpc API.

This is just a proof of concept prototype for how you could add a
baremetal specific rpc API to the nova-compute service.  This came up as
it there was some desire to have some baremetal specific rpc methods.
This approach has some nice properties.  It allows a baremetal specific
API that is completely independent from the compute rpc API (versioning,
implementation, the queues it uses), but without having to create a new
service for it.

Change-Id: Idf12c418a8ce1bc873e7ad6f702351e95d31aca3
'}]
commit_message:
Prototype of a baremetal specific rpc API.

This is just a proof of concept prototype for how you could add a
baremetal specific rpc API to the nova-compute service.  This came up as
it there was some desire to have some baremetal specific rpc methods.
This approach has some nice properties.  It allows a baremetal specific
API that is completely independent from the compute rpc API (versioning,
implementation, the queues it uses), but without having to create a new
service for it.

Change-Id: Idf12c418a8ce1bc873e7ad6f702351e95d31aca3

commit_message:
Distribute resource mapping to individual modules

Define the mapping from resource names to classes locally in each module
and then aggregate them. This moves the mappings near the definitions, and
provides the format for an eventual plug-in resource architecture.

Change-Id: I3e70d495c5a490ae20d38bf1aec7e28080a55520
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Move the resource module out of the resources package

Leave only the actual resource implementations in the heat.engine.resources
package. This is the first step to implementing a plugin-style architecture
for resources.

Change-Id: I8a63da4f54b087ee792969678f92da8e31787a3e
Signed-off-by: Zane Bitter <zbitter@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2012-11-28 21:55:29.000000000', 'message': 'Always call 'spawn_after' for eventlet in fake mode.

This commit changes the "eventlet_spawner" function used by fake mode
to always call eventlet.spawn_after, even when the time is zero.
The code had been recently changed to skip calling spawn_after, but it
turned out this changed the behavior of the API in fake mode.

Change-Id: Ic53c02b88a915893ada28e6765a18c2ed193df72

commit_message:
Always call 'spawn_after' for eventlet in fake mode.

This commit changes the "eventlet_spawner" function used by fake mode
to always call eventlet.spawn_after, even when the time is zero.
The code had been recently changed to skip calling spawn_after, but it
turned out this changed the behavior of the API in fake mode.

Change-Id: Ic53c02b88a915893ada28e6765a18c2ed193df72
Fixes: bug #1084144

commit_message:
Update migration so it supports PostgreSQL.

Updates the 'deleted' columns so that they are treated as
Booleans instead of integers. This makes it so that
144_add_node_to_migrations.py works on both MySQL and PostgreSQL.

Fixes LP Bug #1084208.

Change-Id: Ibff1c45117e47126a255b2a1df5e915c881cb5c1

commit_message:
Upgrade pep8 to 1.3.3.

This required a bunch of whitespace-poking of the scripts in bin, but
that's all. Now every file in swift/ and bin/ is pep8-1.3.3-compliant,
so hopefully we can be done with this pep8 stuff for a good long time.

Change-Id: I44fdb41d219c57400a4c396ab7eb0ffa9dcd8db8

so add python-keystoneclient dependency.

commit_message:
Add methods to Host operations to fake hypervisor

This patch implements some features present in os-hosts extension that are not
implemented in fake hypervisor:
    - Power Actions: Shutdown/Reboot/Startup a host
    - Change host status: enable or disable
    - Set/Unset the host into maintenance mode
With this patch we're able to get full api samples for this extension

Change-Id: I3b76e3070e326b39a67b9d4d25b5e3d91a3c102f

commit_message:
Improve provider_location cleanup code for RBD.

The RBD driver does not make use of the 'provider_location' field
but the current cleanup code assumes it does.  Ensure the field
is in use before testing whether or not it needs fixing.

Fixes bug 1083818.

Change-Id: Id6ff85101f85e70575ba244c2df7aca0196cf224
(cherry picked from commit d030c5b10e9e8d73d967562259e7db6146347108)

heckj, I wondered the same thing ... openstack.common.setup reads & writes keystoneclient/versioninfo, which is also also included in .gitignore'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-11-28 18:53:01.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1132, 'date': '2012-11-28 18:56:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Fixed that pep8 violation.

Now to shed some light on what's going on with this patch:

As Dolph pointed out, the common setup code is what generates that versioninfo file. That setup code is called when we build a source tarball (e.g. python setup.py sdist). The versioninfo file is listed in .gitignore as we don't ever need to commit what we generate locally to the master repo. As a side-note, this code is already in use in python-novaclient and python-glanceclient."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-28 19:10:45.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

commit_message:
Disable the image cache manager by default

bug #1075018 and bug #1078594 are very serious issues with the image
cache manager when using shared storage. We couldn't address the
issues in time for 2012.2.1 because of the riskiness of the changes
required.

As a workaround, disable that code by default using:

  image_cache_manager_interval=0

Change-Id: Iab78abf855e919bc3d3278a39882ff6d39bd3c1c

commit_message:
Unpin lxml requirements

Ubuntu is using a much newer version of lxml so
we shouldn't lock the versions in our infrasctructure.

Change-Id: I73589af70e4156968f14d2494b3af36fa8f4794e
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Make project pyflakes clean.

Added both a tox test-env for pyflakes and fixed the current pyflakes errors.
This did actually fix a couple of bugs.

The CI team has started using pyflakes on its projects and also has started
using oslo for things, so ignoring pyflakes warnings on the oslo code was
starting to get old. However, additionally, pyflakes is pretty solid, so we
should maybe consider gating on it across the board. (% locals() is the
biggest thing that we do that it doesn't like)

Change-Id: Iac1ca62db301892b7863711162fcbc74807eb24f

commit_message:
Replace try: import with extras.try_import

The block form:

try:
    import foo
except:
    foo = None

is confusing to code analysis tools looking for redefinition. It's also a
common enough pattern that someone else has encoded it into a library. Let's
use that instead.

Change-Id: I35a5c7a7e3595a51ba1ef1886c3965f463dba04a

This patch makes sure that a route entry for dnsmasq is placed first
before any others (for example the l3-agent one). This makes DHCP work
when network namespaces are disabled.

Change-Id: I241a8e30127d614f7582e10d999521f6486e5255
'}]
commit_message:
Fixes order of route entries.

Fixes bug 1083238

This patch makes sure that a route entry for dnsmasq is placed first
before any others (for example the l3-agent one). This makes DHCP work
when network namespaces are disabled.

Change-Id: I241a8e30127d614f7582e10d999521f6486e5255

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-28 01:54:02.000000000', 'message': "Improve provider_location cleanup code for RBD.

The RBD driver does not make use of the 'provider_location' field
but the current cleanup code assumes it does.  Ensure the field
is in use before testing whether or not it needs fixing.

Fixes bug 1083818.

Note: Applying to stable/folsom nova-volume code.  Same fix
proposed to cinder @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17023/

Change-Id: I814bd253d2e850534a673985e499f8cdbcebb18e
"}]
commit_message:
Improve provider_location cleanup code for RBD.

The RBD driver does not make use of the 'provider_location' field
but the current cleanup code assumes it does.  Ensure the field
is in use before testing whether or not it needs fixing.

Fixes bug 1083818.

Note: Applying to stable/folsom nova-volume code.  Same fix
proposed to cinder @ https://review.openstack.org/#/c/17023/

Change-Id: I814bd253d2e850534a673985e499f8cdbcebb18e

commit_message:
Remove default_image config option

The value of this option hasn't been used outside of the tests since
the very early days of the project. There's no particular reason
to have a config option for this test value, so just delete it.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I00a08d4dc539f92f4fa4bd8c3c8756e5029d193f

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-28 12:18:30.000000000', 'message': 'Use flags() helper method to override config in tests

Setting config option values using setattr() is dangerous because the
value remains set even after the particular test finishes, so you can
end up with other tests relying on it and being unable to run tests
in isolation.

We have a helper method for doing this, just use it.

Change-Id: I872d7a4f70eceb9ff64f56901cb45552f237c733
'}]
commit_message:
Use flags() helper method to override config in tests

Setting config option values using setattr() is dangerous because the
value remains set even after the particular test finishes, so you can
end up with other tests relying on it and being unable to run tests
in isolation.

We have a helper method for doing this, just use it.

Change-Id: I872d7a4f70eceb9ff64f56901cb45552f237c733

commit_message:
Move ec2 config opts to nova.api.ec2.cloud

Only ec2_dmz_host and ec2_port are used outside of ec2.cloud and in
both cases pipelib is the other module that uses them.

Move all the ec2 options to ec2.cloud and make pipelib explicitly
depend on the ones it needs.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: Ib187ec3421a25bdd86b13dfeae1dc9a07873eb43

commit_message:
Move imagecache code from nova.virt.libvirt.utils

The imagecache related code in libvirt.utils uses the base_dir_name
config option.

If we move the imagecache utils into imagecache, then we can move
the base_dir_name option into that module since there are no other
users of it.

Having all the imagecache code in the imagecache module seems like
a sensible thing to do anyway.

blueprint: scope-config-opts
Change-Id: I1e154aa4de1628d40964207bdcbe5b3b55076442

Fix ini functions to handle spaces in section names

This allows section names to look like:

[ default ]

OpenSSL is the primary offender for this usage.

Change-Id: If5c711107e73cebab9d4a26ca02a7ce572224377

subject: Add partial openSUSE/SLE support
messages:
[{'account_id': 4460, 'date': '2012-10-02 11:45:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Just to make it clear: I volunteer to deal with openSUSE/SLE issues in devstack; just redirect people and assign bugs to me.

Also, as mentioned in the commit message: this first patch is missing package names, so the openSUSE support cannot really be used at the moment. This is because I have a branch that implements package maps (ie, we only define the list of packages we need for debian, and then we have mappings from debian names to fedora and opensuse names). I intend to submit that for review afterwards. Alternatively, we can add a simple package list for openSUSE like we do right now for other distros, but I don't think it scales too well..."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-10-02 12:02:58.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-10-02 11:42:47.000000000', 'message': "Add partial openSUSE/SLE support

Note that this is the first part of the support. A second part involves
dealing with the package names.

Among the changes:
 - correctly detect openSUSE and SLE in GetOSVersion, and set DISTRO
   accordingly
 - new is_suse() function to check if running on a SUSE-based distro
 - use zypper to install packages
 - adapt apache virtual host configuration for openSUSE
 - adapt call to usermod, which has different options in openSUSE:
   there's no -a option (so -a -G can't work), but -A does what we need
   there (but it doesn't on Debian)
 - some simple fixes (path to nova-rootwrap, path to pip, mysql service
   name)

Change-Id: Id2f7c9e18a1c4a7b7cea262ea7959d183e4b0cf0

commit_message:
Add partial openSUSE/SLE support

Note that this is the first part of the support. A second part involves
dealing with the package names.

Among the changes:
 - add several functions to determine some distro-specific behavior (how
   to call usermod, if some features are available on the distro, etc.)
 - correctly detect openSUSE and SLE in GetOSVersion, and set DISTRO
   accordingly
 - new is_suse() function to check if running on a SUSE-based distro
 - use zypper to install packages
 - adapt apache virtual host configuration for openSUSE
 - some simple fixes (path to pip, mysql service name)

Change-Id: Id2f7c9e18a1c4a7b7cea262ea7959d183e4b0cf0

commit_message:
Make resize and multi-node work properly together

[{'created': '2012-11-28 14:59:15.000000000', 'message': 'Split os-aggregates api_samples tests into a file.

While working on another patch, I caused some failures in the
os-aggregates API samples tests.  It takes a while to run *all* of the
API samples tests and all I wanted to run was the ones for
os-aggregates.  This patch splits out these tests into their own file so
that you can run then with just:

    $ tox nova.tests.integrated.api_samples_tests.test_aggregates

If this looks ok, it would be nice to split the rest of
test_api_samples.py up and put future sets of tests in their own file.

Change-Id: Ife8a32dab07bb3c70499388618fbcea37246612a
'}]
commit_message:
Split os-aggregates api_samples tests into a file.

While working on another patch, I caused some failures in the
os-aggregates API samples tests.  It takes a while to run *all* of the
API samples tests and all I wanted to run was the ones for
os-aggregates.  This patch splits out these tests into their own file so
that you can run then with just:

    $ tox nova.tests.integrated.api_samples_tests.test_aggregates

If this looks ok, it would be nice to split the rest of
test_api_samples.py up and put future sets of tests in their own file.

Change-Id: Ife8a32dab07bb3c70499388618fbcea37246612a

commit_message:
The change implemented Lbaas CRUD Sqlalchemy operations.

- Added loadbalancer plugin which only perform the Sqlalchemy
  operations.
- Added unit test against the loadbalancer plugin.
- Rebased with the latest changes committed by Oleg and Eugene

Change-Id: Ifc59182ba118aa32c506658ffab6b695b050c851
Implemets: bp/lbaas-plugin-api-crud

[{'created': '2012-11-19 14:52:54.000000000', 'message': "make QuantumV2 support requested nic ordering

fixes bug 1064524

The QuantumV2 did not honor nic ordering, so nics were attached in
Quantum's db natural order.  This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
ordering when Nova calls the V2Quantum API.  Unit tests have been updated to
confirm ordering is honored.

Change-Id: I787296a577ec97da2cf9b08ce5a7b83f0d912bb6
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
"}]
commit_message:
make QuantumV2 support requested nic ordering

fixes bug 1064524

The QuantumV2 did not honor nic ordering, so nics were attached in
Quantum's db natural order.  This patch sorts the networks honor requested nic
ordering when Nova calls the V2Quantum API.  Unit tests have been updated to
confirm ordering is honored.

Change-Id: I787296a577ec97da2cf9b08ce5a7b83f0d912bb6
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
improved horizon setup

* mysql as default db
* login check
  to make sure horizon dashboard is up
  usage:
    source lib/horizon
    SERVER_HOST=localhost
    ADMIN_PASSWORD=somepass
    check_horizon

Change-Id: Ib9fdfa677f10943bca658aa21094ccb5f4f08969

commit_message:
Eliminates simultaneous schedule race.

Keeps host state in memory so multiple schedule attempts use the
up-to-date values that may have been modified by another greenthread.

Fixes bug 1073956

Change-Id: I9ccd4a51fbc31b60534e3cbbb34e0194b473fdf2
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Fixes copy_from to work with http and swift

Using copy_from with an http endpoint and having
a swift datastore results in an error of:

TypeError: object of type 'CooperativeReader'
has no len()

Adding in a read() to the ResponseIndexable solves
this and also later problems where the response is
read() from.

Fixes bug 1057322

Change-Id: Ief5d6ca9af8a644935418a091c9be45fd4294fd6

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 12:28:53.000000000', 'message': "Fixed deleted image being downloadable by admin.

When an image is being added to cache and a DELETE request for same image
arrives, the image remains in the 'cache' directory. Since an admin user can
see deleted images (v1 API), he is also able to download the image. Also, the
image persists in the cache forever.
Raised NotFound exception for deleted image and cleaned up the deleted image
from cache to resolve the issue permanently.

Fixes LP: #1081941

Change-Id: Ia82927719b6f7d20f8467eca12e8c91424e0f438
"}, {'created': '2012-11-26 10:54:54.000000000', 'message': "Fixed deleted image being downloadable by admin.

When an image is being added to cache and a DELETE request for same image
arrives, the image remains in the 'cache' directory. Admin user should
not be able to download such images.
Raised NotFound exception for deleted image so that a 404 is returned.

Fixes LP: #1081941

Change-Id: Ia82927719b6f7d20f8467eca12e8c91424e0f438
"}, {'created': '2012-11-27 08:34:03.000000000', 'message': 'Fixed deleted image being downloadable by admin.

Raised NotFound exception for deleted image, so that a 404 gets
returned for download.

Fixes LP: #1081941

Change-Id: Ia82927719b6f7d20f8467eca12e8c91424e0f438
'}]
commit_message:
Fixed deleted image being downloadable by admin.

Raised NotFound exception for deleted image, so that a 404 gets
returned for download.

Fixes LP: #1081941

Change-Id: Ia82927719b6f7d20f8467eca12e8c91424e0f438

commit_message:
Provide i18n to those messages without _()

bug 1081498

There are a few log messages without _(), but a lot messages with _().
Wrap these log messages with _() in order to make the code consistent.

Change-Id: Ie8961453569e9a75bd0fd0733344db8059d05222

commit_message:
Migration model update for multi-node resize fix.

Adds source_node and dest_node to Migration model records for
compatibility with multi-node resizes.

The accompanying database migration:
* Adds source and dest node information to existing Migration records
* Fixes the node field on Instance records that have been resized.

bug 1081355

Change-Id: I4b58821174a262ed7885aba1fc79b3b67c9aa859

commit_message:
Use auth_token middleware from keystoneclient.

auth_token middleware has been move from keystone to python-keystonecient,
so add python-keystoneclient dependence instead of keystone.Also adds
missing signing_dir option.

Change-Id: I24a4f422c35b721338c7519212c21ed2fbc255b3

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-28 01:52:14.000000000', 'message': "Improve provider_location cleanup code for RBD.

The RBD driver does not make use of the 'provider_location' field
but the current cleanup code assumes it does.  Ensure the field
is in use before testing whether or not it needs fixing.

Fixes bug 1083818.

Change-Id: Id6ff85101f85e70575ba244c2df7aca0196cf224
"}]
commit_message:
Improve provider_location cleanup code for RBD.

The RBD driver does not make use of the 'provider_location' field
but the current cleanup code assumes it does.  Ensure the field
is in use before testing whether or not it needs fixing.

Fixes bug 1083818.

Change-Id: Id6ff85101f85e70575ba244c2df7aca0196cf224

commit_message:
Ensure create user API uses specified username.

Fixed issue where using the api to create an user, it would always create an user with the name of the reddwarf admin username and not the one specified.

Fixes bug 1083826

Change-Id: I2448eede88b7da8cabf824a9cf974a4ccf7ab6ec

[{'created': '2012-11-27 23:53:36.000000000', 'message': 'Update tools/install_venv.py to work w/ latest pip

pip dropped the -E option as of 1.1; now to install in a virtualenv,
you just explicitly activate the virtualenv.  This commit fakes the
same behavior of explicitly specifying a virtualenv for installation
by altering tools/with_venv.sh to optionally take the -E flag

Fixes Bug #1081200

Change-Id: I470ba9563864337b8af2a79ae463e269ba66bf8f

Fixes Bug #1081200

Change-Id: I470ba9563864337b8af2a79ae463e269ba66bf8f
"}]
commit_message:
Update tools/install_venv.py to work w/ latest pip

pip dropped the -E option as of 1.1; now to install in a virtualenv,
you just explicitly activate the virtualenv.  This commit fakes the
same behavior of explicitly specifying a virtualenv for installation
by altering tools/with_venv.sh to optionally take the -E flag

Fixes Bug #1081200

Change-Id: I470ba9563864337b8af2a79ae463e269ba66bf8f

subject: Part of the patch set that enables VM's to use libvirts bridge type.
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/1/check/gate-quantum-merge/2654 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/1/check/gate-quantum-docs/1893 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/1/check/gate-quantum-pep8/2513 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/1/check/gate-quantum-python26/2283 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/1/check/gate-quantum-python27/2284 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 490, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me, but someone else must approve

'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Ok, this one makes me nervous - lots more info needed

Firstly, it's a big patch that touches tricky parts of the code - looks like it could easily break a tonne of stuff

The commit message references a blueprint, so is it a new feature?

In the bug report, the only description of how this is a "high-impact, user-visible bug" is that the current implementation is "problematic in a number of respects"

It sounds like this will change the semantics of the Quantum API in some respect such that Nova and Quantum need to be updated at the same time by users - not something we want to happen on the stable branch


... so, could you clarify in detail on those points?'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Hi Mark,
The commit message should certainly be updated. The reaosn for this patch is to fix bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/quantum/+bug/1078210. This enables libvirt to set the network type as bridge. At the moment it is ethernet. This means that there are SELinux issue and performance issues when using the linuxbridge plugi. The patch enables nova to create the bridge instead of the agent creating the bridge. Once this patch is in we will be able to back port the nova side of things. My feeling is that this should be backported and is very importnat for those using the linxbridge plugin.
Thaks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/gate/gate-quantum-merge/2889 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/gate/gate-quantum-docs/2128 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/gate/gate-quantum-pep8/2748 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/gate/gate-quantum-python26/2518 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/gate/gate-quantum-python27/2519 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: No score

Starting gate jobs.
https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/check/gate-quantum-merge/2765 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/check/gate-quantum-docs/2004 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/2624 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/check/gate-quantum-python26/2394 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16223/2/check/gate-quantum-python27/2395 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

I have to say, my instinct here is to reject this

Saying that Quantum's use of type="ethernet" is a "high-impact, user-visible bug" is a bit of a stretch ... but maybe not a huge stretch. We know it doesn't work with SELinux, that performance with virtio is sub-optimal and probably a bunch of other issues.

Also, there's a bunch of stuff in this patch that really doesn't look related to fixing the bug - e.g. the removal of the gateway code. Anything not related to the bug fix is just extra risk and we're trying to avoid risk on the stable branch.

Similarly, splitting out ensure_physical_in_bridge() looks like pure refactoring. The refactoring should have been done as a separate patch to make it easier to see the behaviour changes.

It looks like the only true behaviour change is the removal of the 'delif' code. I can see why the 'delif' code doesn't work with the new Nove behaviour, but how is deleting it not changing the old behviour?

...

However, after talking it over with danwent on IRC, I see the point that this plugin is used relatively little and that the people who do use it will enough from this patch for it to be worth the risk. The people who don't use it aren't subject to any risk.

So, given all that and the fact that the code has landed on master, I'm going ahead and approving.

...

I think we'll have to wait until after 2012.2.1 to merge the Nova side of this now since we want to lock down 2012.2.1.

However, whenever we do merge it, please make sure we add a note to the release notes (i.e. there'll be a http://wiki.openstack.org/ReleaseNotes/2012.2.2 similar to http://wiki.openstack.org/ReleaseNotes/2012.2.1) warning users that they need to upgrade Quantum before Nova if they're using the linuxbridge plugin'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1955, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Is there corresponding part in Nova and is it in stable/folsom?'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-27 23:46:54.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

commit_message:
Part of the patch set that enables VM's to use libvirts bridge type.

Fixes bug 1078210

The patch set enables the following:
1. Bridges to be created by Nova
2. Bridges to be created by the agent

The code is backward compatible, that is, if Nova does not create the brdige
then the agent will create the bridge.

In addition to this it cleans gateway code no longer used.

The patch enables the following Nova code to be backported:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14830/

Change-Id: Ia621ba5edd12d8eb7ea412a2993fea43189bd511

broke update.py. Use the new positional argument infrastructure.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-27 20:47:55.000000000', 'message': 'Ensure strings passed to librbd are not unicode

librbd rejects unicode by throwing an exception. If the location uri
was unicode, this would result in deletes failing. Convert all rbd
StoreLocation properties to ascii strings to avoid this problem.

Fixes bug #1075580
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

Change-Id: I445902bb1b72b8c814585f1481e6bf9e758b4e07
(cherry picked from commit 3aea9320d20d0291c5b4b027a585370d8e658a95)
'}]
commit_message:
Ensure strings passed to librbd are not unicode

librbd rejects unicode by throwing an exception. If the location uri
was unicode, this would result in deletes failing. Convert all rbd
StoreLocation properties to ascii strings to avoid this problem.

Fixes bug #1075580
Signed-off-by: Josh Durgin <josh.durgin@inktank.com>

Change-Id: I445902bb1b72b8c814585f1481e6bf9e758b4e07
(cherry picked from commit 3aea9320d20d0291c5b4b027a585370d8e658a95)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-26 22:25:05.000000000', 'message': 'Make cooperative reader always support read()

glance.common.utils.CooperativeReader provides eventlet-friendly
cooperation on top of backends that support either read() or __iter__().
However, in the case of backends that only support __iter__(), such as
images returned by store.get(...), read() is not defined. This patch
adds read() in all cases.

Fixes bug 1057322.

Change-Id: I67d9b3e4d93fbefd7eeaf7cfc947ab635fe09534
'}]
commit_message:
Make cooperative reader always support read()

glance.common.utils.CooperativeReader provides eventlet-friendly
cooperation on top of backends that support either read() or __iter__().
However, in the case of backends that only support __iter__(), such as
images returned by store.get(...), read() is not defined. This patch
adds read() in all cases.

Fixes bug 1057322.

Change-Id: I67d9b3e4d93fbefd7eeaf7cfc947ab635fe09534

commit_message:
Fixes order of route entries.

Fixes bug 1083238

This patch makes sure that a route entry for dnsmasq is placed first
before any others (for example the l3-agent one). This makes DHCP work
when network namespaces are disabled.

Change-Id: I241a8e30127d614f7582e10d999521f6486e5255

commit_message:
Use DB count to get resource counts.

Fixes bug 1075369, and includes bugs 1081259, 1083696 which fixed
regression in the original version of this patch and bug 1083180
which improves the documentation of the original patch.

During quota check we used to simply retrieve the entire collection
of resources from the database, then counting them in Python. This
patch introduces a specialized _get_collection_count() method, which
instead take advantage of the DB's built-in count capabilities.

In order to take advantage of this, plugins can now implement
get_*_count() methods for their resources. This is used (if present)
by the quota checking function.

Change-Id: Idc347cfacc363f2cac47356296514fe735625f29

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-20 08:03:06.000000000', 'message': 'Stop loss of precision when writing 'x-object-meta-mtime'

str(float) isn't a good way of converting a float to a string with all the precision

Eg

    >>> f = os.path.getmtime("z")
    >>> f
    1347717491.343554
    >>> str(f)
    '1347717491.34'
    >>> "%f" % f
    '1347717491.343554'

Change-Id: I6eb02f7f6730eff814c348d1039eae4606642b52
'}]
commit_message:
Stop loss of precision when writing 'x-object-meta-mtime'

str(float) isn't a good way of converting a float to a string with all the precision

Eg

    >>> f = os.path.getmtime("z")
    >>> f
    1347717491.343554
    >>> str(f)
    '1347717491.34'
    >>> "%f" % f
    '1347717491.343554'

Change-Id: I6eb02f7f6730eff814c348d1039eae4606642b52

commit_message:
Fixes live_migration missing migrate_data parameter in Hyper-V driver

Fixes Bug #1066513

Live migration on Hyper-V fails due to the parameter "migrate_data" that
has been added to the signature of live_migration(...) in
nova.virt.ComputeDriver.

This fix adds the new parameter.

Change-Id: I393f6706bc144838ae232dfb275460620bc203e2
(cherry picked from commit 448a578feb6edab148ef97328e57aeb06eb7360b)

[{'created': '2012-11-22 01:32:54.000000000', 'message': 'Fix use_single_default_gateway

With FlatDHCP and use_single_default_gateway nova-network creates
an invalid entry in the dnsmasq .opts file for the network that
contains a blank router option.  New instances will not receive
a default gateway.

Change-Id: I4c2da61def0681b7b253ae387bf83c069484e28b
Fixes: bug #1075859
(cherry picked from commit 1b455923446de6fcfee7166059db72b80ff51dfe)
'}]
commit_message:
Fix use_single_default_gateway

With FlatDHCP and use_single_default_gateway nova-network creates
an invalid entry in the dnsmasq .opts file for the network that
contains a blank router option.  New instances will not receive
a default gateway.

Change-Id: I4c2da61def0681b7b253ae387bf83c069484e28b
Fixes: bug #1075859
(cherry picked from commit 1b455923446de6fcfee7166059db72b80ff51dfe)

subject: Use DB count to get resource counts.
messages: [{'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-11-27 21:16:03.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned\n\noops, i squashed two reviews into one, but forgot to remove the second change-id from the commit, which caused this to show up as a second review.'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-27 21:16:03.000000000', 'message': 'Use DB count to get resource counts.

Fixes bug 1075369, and includes bugs 1081259, 1083696 which fixed
regression in the original version of this patch and bug 1083180
which improves the documentation of the original patch.

During quota check we used to simply retrieve the entire collection
of resources from the database, then counting them in Python. This
patch introduces a specialized _get_collection_count() method, which
instead take advantage of the DB's built-in count capabilities.

In order to take advantage of this, plugins can now implement
get_*_count() methods for their resources. This is used (if present)
by the quota checking function.

Change-Id: Idc347cfacc363f2cac47356296514fe735625f29

fix so cisco plugin db model to not override count methods

bug 1083696

also fixes bug 1083180, which has L3 plugin base class implement
get_*_count methods and raise
NotImplemented, which is the "right" thing to do from a
code-as-documentation perspective.

Change-Id: I0367953bcea930b1ca70e416d3de22eeea1aa99d
'}]
commit_message:
Use DB count to get resource counts.

Fixes bug 1075369, and includes bugs 1081259, 1083696 which fixed
regression in the original version of this patch and bug 1083180
which improves the documentation of the original patch.

During quota check we used to simply retrieve the entire collection
of resources from the database, then counting them in Python. This
patch introduces a specialized _get_collection_count() method, which
instead take advantage of the DB's built-in count capabilities.

In order to take advantage of this, plugins can now implement
get_*_count() methods for their resources. This is used (if present)
by the quota checking function.

Change-Id: Idc347cfacc363f2cac47356296514fe735625f29

fix so cisco plugin db model to not override count methods

bug 1083696

also fixes bug 1083180, which has L3 plugin base class implement
get_*_count methods and raise
NotImplemented, which is the "right" thing to do from a
code-as-documentation perspective.

Change-Id: I0367953bcea930b1ca70e416d3de22eeea1aa99d

commit_message:
Use 'notifications' as default notification queue name

All OpenStack projects uses `notifications' as topic by default, except
Glance, let's fix that.

This fixes bug #1083648

Change-Id: I973164f35a9466eb543656546d3110c6430170ef
Signed-off-by: Julien Danjou <julien@danjou.info>

commit_message:
Fix None being passed into as_int().

Currently when a create is received and the size is of NoneType
a stack trace is dumped because of the TypeError. This will
correct it so the functionality won't change, but the TypeError
is will be caught now.

Change-Id: Ic83dd182e0083c887af8f6209a23af38bfff2be7

commit_message:
Migrate DHCP host info during resize

Update instance host to migration_ref['dest_compute'] before
update_dhcp to make its DHCP host info will be written in dhcp-hostsfile.

Make similiar change in finish_revert_resize.

Fixes bug 1065440

Change-Id: I9d3e0ebf8512f98f2943999e7ad95bc58f2bf585
(cherry picked from commit 9ea41fc80b46b0c5adbab3ea191b92583feb02e0)

commit_message:
Add exceptions to baremetal/db/api

Raise exceptions from baremetal/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
  following the precedents from nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py.
Fixes tests to expect the new exceptions.
Adds __init__ so that baremetal tests work in isolation.

blueprint general-bare-metal-provisioning-framework

Change-Id: Ic8ef66e8f3180460a7bf117fccbfe15078905d8b

nits'}, {'account_id': 3031, 'date': '2012-11-01 21:54:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

I think the setting for the rabbit server needs to be modified slightly to come more into line with openstack-common code

Eg. Add ability to set ssl flag, rabbit_ha flag and specify multiple hosts.'}, {'account_id': 475, 'date': '2012-11-01 21:58:46.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Metacomment: I wonder if it'd be easier to at-a-glance tie all of these cells commits together by using the 'cells:' prefix on the commit msg just like we do for virt-layer fixes. Just a thought...."}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:04:31.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:10:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:11:36.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:12:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Rick: good idea.  Done.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:12:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:12:32.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Brian: Good call.  Hopefully clarified now.'}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:13:35.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Sam: I agree.  However, I'd rather not mix in a DB migration just yet.  There are number of other things that should be fixed up with the cells table after we can get the base of it to land."}, {'account_id': 679, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:15:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

Wait…doesn't this need a migration?"}, {'account_id': 1030, 'date': '2012-11-01 22:21:26.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3:

[{'created': '2012-11-27 15:59:29.000000000', 'message': "Check parameter 'marker' before make request to glance

fix bug: 1065053

Since glance need parameter 'marker' to be a image-id, can not
be None. check 'marker' before make request to glance.

Change-Id: I7fc063ea74ae3be71e2effdc0b62432ebdd52c27
(cherry picked from commit d23cf2096fe62c1e575e79c4ff0af3f1fb7830ad)
"}]
commit_message:
Check parameter 'marker' before make request to glance

fix bug: 1065053

Since glance need parameter 'marker' to be a image-id, can not
be None. check 'marker' before make request to glance.

Change-Id: I7fc063ea74ae3be71e2effdc0b62432ebdd52c27
(cherry picked from commit d23cf2096fe62c1e575e79c4ff0af3f1fb7830ad)

commit_message:
normalize identity

modify tables by adding columns, and modify entities
by adding attributes for password, description and enabled

update tests to deal with change from 'False' and 'True' to the
python values False and True

Added a Text type from SQL Alchemy

Bug 1070351
Bug 1023544

Change-Id: I066c788b5d08a8f42a9b5412ea9e29e4fe9ba205

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-21 20:16:58.000000000', 'message': "Fix config-file overrides for nova-dhcpbridge

nova-dhcpbridge can read in an alternate config file location but wasn't
using it to parse config options.  This fixes a regression introduced in
00786bc554a2dfacb3c6f02fbb7e9c98f35d4262.

This change is motivated by the fact that nova-dhcpbridge is passed to
dnsmasq in restart_dhcp() in nova/network/linux_net.py, and there is
currently no support for overriding config options for nova-dhcpbridge
in that call.  There is support for overriding the FLAGFILE env variable
in that call, but nova-dhcpbridge was ignoring that.  If I start
nova-network with an alternate config this provides a way for me to pass
that config to nova-dhcpbridge as well.

Change-Id: I002ea768500555a089bd1d5b0fea2354b27fba14
(cherry picked from commit ae0a0d54351e71e3d723d7c0c6de8db2cdbab772)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix config-file overrides for nova-dhcpbridge

nova-dhcpbridge can read in an alternate config file location but wasn't
using it to parse config options.  This fixes a regression introduced in
00786bc554a2dfacb3c6f02fbb7e9c98f35d4262.

This change is motivated by the fact that nova-dhcpbridge is passed to
dnsmasq in restart_dhcp() in nova/network/linux_net.py, and there is
currently no support for overriding config options for nova-dhcpbridge
in that call.  There is support for overriding the FLAGFILE env variable
in that call, but nova-dhcpbridge was ignoring that.  If I start
nova-network with an alternate config this provides a way for me to pass
that config to nova-dhcpbridge as well.

Change-Id: I002ea768500555a089bd1d5b0fea2354b27fba14
(cherry picked from commit ae0a0d54351e71e3d723d7c0c6de8db2cdbab772)

commit_message:
Display errors when running nosetests

During Ubuntu builds we run the run_test.sh script
during the package build process, so that we can catch
regressions in our packaging before uploading to the archive.

However a recent change writes the output of the nosetests
to an error log so we don't see why the package fail to build.

This patch also displays the output of the nosetests so we
can see why the tests fail without having to look at the nosetests.log.

This patch add the '-v', for a verbose display of nosetests.

Change-Id: Id21d53df356de344a8577282c5a82f3ff927bc11
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
Provide better error message for aggregate-create

For an InvalidAggregateAction exception:
Before: 'ERROR: There was a conflict when trying to complete your request (HTTP 409)'
After: 'ERROR: Cannot perform action 'create_aggregate' on aggregate 'N/A'. Reason: invalid zone. (HTTP 400)'

Fix bug 1083353

Change-Id: I26e30059fe5bbc30eecc52cccec4eba2a57d00db

commit_message:
Validate rxtx_factor as a float.

Updates the rxtx_factor validations in the instance_types modules so
that rxtx_factor is validated as a float. Given that rxtx_factor is stored
as a float in the database this makes sense... and also adheres
to some of the extension documentation as well (although some of
the extension docs were incorrect as well).

Previously rxtx_factor was being cast into an int which caused it to
be stored and displayed incorrectly via the API.

This patchset adds a test which fails with the old code.

Additionally some of the API docs are corrected so that rxtx_factor is
listed as a float in all examples.

Fixes LP Bug #1081287.

Change-Id: Iae98522a1f2ed63cbd2497b0b0af5ac2d9bb935c

commit_message:
fix so cisco plugin db model to not override count methods

bug 1083696

also fixes bug 1083180, which has L3 plugin base class implement
get_*_count methods and raise
NotImplemented, which is the "right" thing to do from a
code-as-documentation perspective.

Change-Id: I0367953bcea930b1ca70e416d3de22eeea1aa99d

commit_message:
Use NOVA_BIN_DIR for newer binaries.

We added a variable a while ago, NOVA_BIN_DIR which is set properly to the
location of the binaries. Rather than using the in-tree bin-dir, which is
going away in favor of entrypoints console_scripts.

Change-Id: I65040cfe8321d49595a909353870f981bbd6a480

commit_message:
Add start of the EC2/S3 API testing to tempest

Continues the effort of the https://review.openstack.org/#/c/3064/

* add EC2 keypair and volume tests
* add EC2 snapshot from volume test
* add EC2 floating ip disasscioation
* add EC2 operation on security group
* add EC2/S3 image registration
* add EC2 instance run test
* add Integration test with ssh, console, volume
* add S3 object and bucket tests

Change-Id: I0dff9b05f215b56456272f22aa1c014cd53b4f4b

commit_message:
Use auth_token middleware in keystoneclient.

The auth_token middleware moved into keystoneclient so a full
keystone install is not required to use the middleware.Also
add missing signing_dir to api-paste.ini.

Change-Id: If6c339045b70b3d4d70f0297ec32ed3cfdf431de

[{'created': '2012-11-25 03:20:42.000000000', 'message': 'Make pep8 checks a bit stricter.

Along with moving to pep8 1.3.3, we also want to standardize
on what we ignore.  This means there are quite a few issues with indentation.

This patch is an effort to go through and bring the cinder project up to date with
1.3.3 and only have the following ignores in run_tests.sh:
    E125,E126,E711,E712

Change-Id: If45f156600485d23769449018590f60b4f69b0c5
'}, {'created': '2012-11-26 23:18:41.000000000', 'message': "Make pep8 checks a bit stricter.

Along with moving to pep8 1.3.3, we also want to standardize
on what we ignore. This patch get's us most of the way there
by setting the ignore list to:
N4,E125, E126, E711,E712.

Almost all changes made here are white-space/indentation changes.

The removal of Hacking N4 errors from the ignore list will
be handled in a seperate patch.

Change-Id: If45f156600485d23769449018590f60b4f69b0c5
"}, {'created': '2012-11-26 23:57:18.000000000', 'message': "Make pep8 checks a bit stricter.

Along with moving to pep8 1.3.3, we also want to standardize
on what we ignore. This patch get's us most of the way there
by setting the ignore list to:
N4,E125, E126, E711,E712.

Almost all changes made here are white-space/indentation changes.

The removal of Hacking N4 errors from the ignore list will
be handled in a seperate patch.

Change-Id: If45f156600485d23769449018590f60b4f69b0c5
"}]
commit_message:
Make pep8 checks a bit stricter.

Along with moving to pep8 1.3.3, we also want to standardize
on what we ignore. This patch get's us most of the way there
by setting the ignore list to:
N4,E125, E126, E711,E712.

Almost all changes made here are white-space/indentation changes.

The removal of Hacking N4 errors from the ignore list will
be handled in a seperate patch.

Change-Id: If45f156600485d23769449018590f60b4f69b0c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-21 20:22:53.000000000', 'message': "fetch_images() method no more needed

The Nova Glance wrapper returns all images metadata
if the parameter 'limit' is not define. It doesn't
split the image metadata list.

So the sub method fetch_image is no more needed.
We can delete it.

I added a check in Nova Glance wrapper to be sure
the parameter 'marker' or another one aren't set
to 'None' (like in bug #1065053).

Fixes LP bug #1070904

Change-Id: I24ecc4adf158401f60b508aa3a20bd4c91bfa92b
(cherry picked from commit 17149f688d22e4f4938674f7179a03caeafbfc93)
"}]
commit_message:
fetch_images() method no more needed

The Nova Glance wrapper returns all images metadata
if the parameter 'limit' is not define. It doesn't
split the image metadata list.

So the sub method fetch_image is no more needed.
We can delete it.

I added a check in Nova Glance wrapper to be sure
the parameter 'marker' or another one aren't set
to 'None' (like in bug #1065053).

Fixes LP bug #1070904

Change-Id: I24ecc4adf158401f60b508aa3a20bd4c91bfa92b
(cherry picked from commit 17149f688d22e4f4938674f7179a03caeafbfc93)

'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-11-12 19:29:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Isn't the "adminness" of a particular Compute API call dependent on the policy.json file that lives in the particular compute API server?'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-11-12 21:26:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I'm not sure what you mean by "adminness". I know only certain users can be configured as admins, and the functionality they have available can be limited as well. My assumption for these functional tests was going to be that the admin user has the expected permissions. Is there something else I'm missing?'}, {'account_id': 7, 'date': '2012-11-13 15:15:24.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Daryl, the "adminness" of a call (i.e. whether or not you need admin role privileges to make a call) is determined based on the policy.json file installed on the server (this is the same in Nova, Keystone, Cinder, Quantum and Glance, since all of this derives from the policy.json work in openstack-common)

http://docs.openstack.org/trunk/openstack-compute/install/content/keystone-concepts.html

Therefore, what I am saying is that these tests are assuming the default policy.json file that goes along with Nova's default installation -- and I wanted to point that out. It may be useful to have a config setting called "uses_default_policy" or something to enable environments that do NOT use the default policy files to skip these tests...'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-11-13 19:11:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I see what you're saying. I think an "default_policy" flag would be an okay short term solution, but given that it's very likely outside a devstack environment that people may high widely varying configurations, parsing policy file and then determining which tests to run in which context or skip might be a more flexible long term solution. Given all that, would it make more sense for me to put these client methods in the servers client to avoid confusion?'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-11-13 21:29:19.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

This is related to the issue of whether various extensions are supported which has the same problem. My, perhaps controversial, opinion is that we already have a lot to deal with and should assume the out-of-the-box configuration. That will work for the upstream testing scenarios and a lot of others as well. If some one wants to run tempest against a cluster that has tweaked the extensions or policy files in a way that breaks some of the tests, they can modify the test runner config to skip the tests they don't want to run."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-11-14 15:10:15.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

I see your point David. However, I'm not sure how comfortable I feel assuming that people are using an out of the box config. If we want to use Tempest for more than just gating trunk, it needs to be flexible enough to use in anyone's environment (just my opinion as well). Since this commit does not include any tests, could we make the decision on where the client code belongs here and then move the larger discussion of how we handle tests based on extensions/configurations on the mailing list? I'm sure there's quite a few people who would want to weigh in."}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-11-14 16:01:21.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

I was not saying we should assume people are running out-of-the-box. I was suggesting that we not spend time to build elaborate opt-in/out infrastructure into tempest but instead leave that to the invoker of the test runner. Obviously the former would be "better" but I think we might do better to spend our time on parallelization, more tests, etc.'}, {'account_id': 1192, 'date': '2012-11-16 21:06:22.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Daryl, I lost track of the status of this. Is it ready to be merged as far as you are concerned?'}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-11-26 07:28:16.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Jay's comments made me think a bit so I believe I'm going to move the client methods into the regular servers client. The configuration code will come with the next merge prop which has the tests."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-11-26 07:34:52.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-26 08:04:33.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

Build failed

- http://logs.openstack.org/15775/3/check/gate-tempest-merge/1065 : SUCCESS

- http://logs.openstack.org/15775/3/check/gate-tempest-devstack-vm/19875 : FAILURE

See inline comment about resetState."}, {'account_id': 97, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:32:04.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 4.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-26 23:18:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Works for me

commit_message:
Declare vpn client option in pipelib

Due to some import refactoring, nova.network.manager isn't always
imported when running pipelib commands, so using the cnt_vpn_clients
option fails. A failing test could not be added because our testing
code imports nova.network.manager so the code config option always
exists in testing.

Fixes bug 1069573

Change-Id: I92b702556bfef2610b86a952dd6f9207fbab102a
(cherry picked from commit ae6920fb6b367b5aa75e02c72275e3149d02cd70)

Dis-associate an auto-assigned floating IP should return proper warning

Fixes bug 1061499

[{'created': '2012-11-21 19:16:10.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: continue detach if instance not found

Currently the libvirt code will always logout of the iscsi target
during detach error, but the exception will cause the volume to
remain in an attached state. This needs to be more consistent, so
This patch checks specifically for not found and logs a warning
and explicitly detaches. Any other exception will leave iscsi
logged in and leave the volume in the attached state.

Fixes bug 1057756

Change-Id: I23bb7f27e8a9b20fdbf62b0629ca8cc448f427c5
(cherry picked from commit cc02f6a5604892fb776158dab06b06f24a25cbfb)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: continue detach if instance not found

Currently the libvirt code will always logout of the iscsi target
during detach error, but the exception will cause the volume to
remain in an attached state. This needs to be more consistent, so
This patch checks specifically for not found and logs a warning
and explicitly detaches. Any other exception will leave iscsi
logged in and leave the volume in the attached state.

Fixes bug 1057756

Change-Id: I23bb7f27e8a9b20fdbf62b0629ca8cc448f427c5
(cherry picked from commit cc02f6a5604892fb776158dab06b06f24a25cbfb)

commit_message:
Fix Incorrect Exception when metadata is over 255 characters

Need to be in sync with Essex. Throw a new exception in api.py when key or value
is over 255 chars. Catch this exception end return back HTTP error 413.

add extra lines in exception.py to make pep8 happy

Fixes bug 1004007

Change-Id: I67694e3a9600b7dd0b80c519327327568751c2a4
(cherry picked from commit db7798a973bb05af5d4668a9f9b20ce62e8a47af)

commit_message:
Update db entry before upate the DHCP host file.

Update fixed IP db entry before upated the DHCP host file.

[{'created': '2012-11-21 18:48:23.000000000', 'message': "Fix XML response for return_reservation_id.

The XML serializer for create uses the server template for it's response.
However, when return_reservation_id is set, only a reservation_id is
going to be returned.

To enable the XML response to be serialized the reservation id is now
returned in a server tag/object.

This commit fixes bug 1061124

Change-Id: Ic74071b1d527c3f3752e296d3fd46a28a99beb76
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 903b51e148c2f9e858b5ea0ca5b230ac308d76c5)
"}]
commit_message:
Fix XML response for return_reservation_id.

The XML serializer for create uses the server template for it's response.
However, when return_reservation_id is set, only a reservation_id is
going to be returned.

To enable the XML response to be serialized the reservation id is now
returned in a server tag/object.

This commit fixes bug 1061124

Change-Id: Ic74071b1d527c3f3752e296d3fd46a28a99beb76
Signed-off-by: Matthew Treinish <treinish@linux.vnet.ibm.com>
(cherry picked from commit 903b51e148c2f9e858b5ea0ca5b230ac308d76c5)

commit_message:
'BackupCreate' rotation parameter >= 0

In the extension 'admin-actions' of OpenStack Compute API, the action
create backups should only accept rotation parameter greater than or
equal to zero.

If the 'rotation' parameter is negative, OS API returns a badRequest
400 HTTP error.

Fixes LP bug #1071168

Change-Id: I6ef08fbecb0f88942cdb16193e9d2c3831866fe9
(cherry picked from commit 6eac65a8e13d3040c0c6561709f59b3d9bab5435)

The libvirt.xml file is written on initial boot of the instance and
may not reflect the current state of the vm if volumes have been

may not reflect the current state of the vm if volumes have been

commit_message:
libvirt: Regenerates xml instead of using on-disk

The libvirt.xml file is written on initial boot of the instance and
may not reflect the current state of the vm if volumes have been
attached. If the libvirt definition of the vm has been lost, it is
safer to regenerate it rather than attempt to load it from the
outdated file. This should properly bring back vms with attached
volumes.

Fixes bug 1073720

Change-Id: Iaa754700a149f09fc0c022fa664c06ad17f505f5
(cherry picked from commit b22c3302ccea6b4b9e685640accbfdbb2856d460)

[{'created': '2012-11-21 18:37:49.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: ignore deleted domain while get block dev

The get_all_block_devices could raise libvirtError if domain was deleted
while listing instances. This will cause LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver to fail
disconnect_volume. This patch ignores the domain that could not be found
to avoid this issue.

Fixes bug 1060836

Change-Id: I9dc994d8ca7fc084830adb4f6f9d3ca10e0fe577
(cherry picked from commit 5a16b8f3e230cad0fb8d1278b42e6754069e8501)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: ignore deleted domain while get block dev

The get_all_block_devices could raise libvirtError if domain was deleted
while listing instances. This will cause LibvirtISCSIVolumeDriver to fail
disconnect_volume. This patch ignores the domain that could not be found
to avoid this issue.

Fixes bug 1060836

Change-Id: I9dc994d8ca7fc084830adb4f6f9d3ca10e0fe577
(cherry picked from commit 5a16b8f3e230cad0fb8d1278b42e6754069e8501)

commit_message:
Used instance uuid rather than id in remove-fixed-ip

remove-fixed-ip called db method fixed_ip_get_by_instance. but
fixed_ip_get_by_instance use instance uuid not id, so change to
uuid in remove-fixed-ip.

Fixed bug: #1065899

Change-Id: Ic7526c7e91933424c04be9bb91d4a98cfedd9b01
(cherry picked from commit 66521a1571f0922f791ae7f405129fb99b870f38)

commit_message:
Fix error on invalid delete_on_termination value

1. Fixed 500 error when an invalid value is passed to 'delete_on_termination'
parameter in 'block_device_mapping' of create server API (json request).
Converted the value to 'bool' (similar to XML request workflow) to fix issue.
2. Also added unit test coverage.

Fixes LP: #1060955

Change-Id: Ib35040f17a3712dac45ec1e3c2f32fee17db7c03
(cherry picked from commit 7c9761b3bb52788021b5bf0eb9726af833db4074)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-19 14:46:31.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI should only snapshot root disk

Change ID I3e2973 broke XenAPI migrations (resizes) as it caused snapshots
of all disks (including swap and ephemeral disks, if enabled) to be sent
over to the destination host.  The destination only expects vhds for the
root disk, named by sequence numbers.  swap and ephemeral disks ended up
with sequence numbers, also, messing up the re-building of the chain on
the destination.

Fixes bug 1064083

Change ID I3e2973 also didn't change the stub of VM.snapshot to
VDI.snapshot, but tests still passed due to the new code ignoring all
exceptions while snapshotting.  Potential issues in
snapshot_attached_here() would also be ignored due to excessive stubbing
in the xenapi migration testing.  This is also addressed here.

Change-Id: I145030f92a75615d056a30cabcb6ca97e34a8b6c
(cherry picked from commit fb101685cc14ed9b0396ce966e571d3fb457c32f)
"}, {'created': '2012-11-20 22:38:51.000000000', 'message': "XenAPI should only snapshot root disk

Change-Id: I145030f92a75615d056a30cabcb6ca97e34a8b6c
(cherry picked from commit fb101685cc14ed9b0396ce966e571d3fb457c32f)
"}]
commit_message:
XenAPI should only snapshot root disk

Change ID I3e2973 broke XenAPI migrations (resizes) as it caused snapshots
of all disks (including swap and ephemeral disks, if enabled) to be sent
over to the destination host.  The destination only expects vhds for the
root disk, named by sequence numbers.  swap and ephemeral disks ended up
with sequence numbers, also, messing up the re-building of the chain on
the destination.

Fixes bug 1064083

Change ID I3e2973 also didn't change the stub of VM.snapshot to
VDI.snapshot, but tests still passed due to the new code ignoring all
exceptions while snapshotting.  Potential issues in
snapshot_attached_here() would also be ignored due to excessive stubbing
in the xenapi migration testing.  This is also addressed here.

Change-Id: I145030f92a75615d056a30cabcb6ca97e34a8b6c
(cherry picked from commit fb101685cc14ed9b0396ce966e571d3fb457c32f)

While detaching volume from an instance, attach_time of the
volume is not updated. This task updates volume['attach_time']
to NONE at detach_volume.

Also modified the default value of XML attribute
volume['attach_time'] '-' to ''(a 0 length string) to
maintain consistency with existing code.

commit_message:
Updated code to update attach_time of a volume while detaching

While detaching volume from an instance, attach_time of the
volume is not updated. This task updates volume['attach_time']
to NONE at detach_volume.

Also modified the default value of XML attribute
volume['attach_time'] '-' to ''(a 0 length string) to
maintain consistency with existing code.

Fixes bug: 1056122

Change-Id: If56ceda6caab80fb803fcf194ed1dfb18808ec3a
(cherry picked from commit ee2dd66c9c2350d9c4aa4ae535daed7e8d72dfb3)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-27 11:44:41.000000000', 'message': 'RBD: fix check_for_setup_error() for client identities other than "admin"

If we have specified an rbd_user, use that configured client
identity to connect to the cluster when enumerating RADOS pools.
In a cluster with Cephx authentication enabled, the host running
cinder does not necessarily have access to the keyring for the
client.admin user.

Fixes bug 1083540.

Change-Id: Idb885763708565b6911392a76fa4bf64ccf260f1
'}]
commit_message:
RBD: fix check_for_setup_error() for client identities other than "admin"

If we have specified an rbd_user, use that configured client
identity to connect to the cluster when enumerating RADOS pools.
In a cluster with Cephx authentication enabled, the host running
cinder does not necessarily have access to the keyring for the
client.admin user.

Fixes bug 1083540.

Change-Id: Idb885763708565b6911392a76fa4bf64ccf260f1

commit_message:
Don't hard code the xen hvmloader path.

Both Ubuntu and Debian place the hvmloader in a
different path which depends on the version is installed.
The reason why this done is so you can different versions
of Xen installed.

As a result change the hvmloader to a configurable option
for libvirt called xen_hvmloader_path.

Change-Id: Ic407d14f56a2518de4cd4ab8872ac2055d20adcd
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-26 23:16:10.000000000', 'message': "Add migration_update to conductor.

This patch adds a migration_update method to the conductor API.  This is
used by the compute manager to push off db access to nova-conductor.
The only field that compute was updating was the status, so that is the
only field allowed by the API.

Instead of just sending the miration_id to the conductor, we are sending
all of the migration data.  This is done in the spirit of
'no-db-messaging'.  While no other data is needed right now, it's easier
to send it all now than have to change the API later.

Change-Id: Ic3150fbc6d5e7b0c9e41681950a7424129cbc968
"}]
commit_message:
Add migration_update to conductor.

This patch adds a migration_update method to the conductor API.  This is
used by the compute manager to push off db access to nova-conductor.
The only field that compute was updating was the status, so that is the
only field allowed by the API.

Instead of just sending the miration_id to the conductor, we are sending
all of the migration data.  This is done in the spirit of
'no-db-messaging'.  While no other data is needed right now, it's easier
to send it all now than have to change the API later.

Change-Id: Ic3150fbc6d5e7b0c9e41681950a7424129cbc968

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary topic argument.

The instance_update method was setting the topic to self.call(), but the
value being passed is the default, so it's unnecessary.  Just remove it.

Change-Id: Iaabd246b8528a0858ee239e790bfcb13e919399a

[{'created': '2012-11-23 13:07:52.000000000', 'message': 'Make nova-dhcpbridge use CONFIG_FILE over FLAGFILE

nova-dhcpbridge's FLAGFILE environment variable is one of the few
remaining references we have to "flags".

Switching to use a new environment variable is easy, but we need
to take care that when you upgrade the code the compute and network
services might not be restarted immediately.

If this happens, the services may launch a new dnsmasq (so rootwrap
needs to continue to support FLAGFILE) or an existing dnsmasq might run
the lease script (so the script needs to support FLAGFILE).

Change-Id: Ieb55daa2507abb8327c7f5a2ef2f682740f31a5d
'}, {'created': '2012-11-26 07:55:16.000000000', 'message': 'Make nova-dhcpbridge use CONFIG_FILE over FLAGFILE

to take care that when you upgrade the code the compute and network
services might not be restarted immediately.

If this happens, the services may launch a new dnsmasq (so rootwrap
needs to continue to support FLAGFILE) or an existing dnsmasq might run
the lease script (so the script needs to support FLAGFILE).

Change-Id: Ieb55daa2507abb8327c7f5a2ef2f682740f31a5d
'}]
commit_message:
Make nova-dhcpbridge use CONFIG_FILE over FLAGFILE

nova-dhcpbridge's FLAGFILE environment variable is one of the few
remaining references we have to "flags".

Switching to use a new environment variable is easy, but we need
to take care that when you upgrade the code the compute and network
services might not be restarted immediately.

If this happens, the services may launch a new dnsmasq (so rootwrap
needs to continue to support FLAGFILE) or an existing dnsmasq might run
the lease script (so the script needs to support FLAGFILE).

Change-Id: Ieb55daa2507abb8327c7f5a2ef2f682740f31a5d

[{'created': '2012-11-27 05:46:58.000000000', 'message': 'Revert "use O_DIRECT when copying from /dev/zero too"

It turns out running oflag=direct against the LVM snapshot fails for an IO error every time.  Works fine against the regular volume, but fails on snapshot.

This reverts commit 1405a6440d646524d41adfed4fc1344948e2871f'}]
commit_message:
Revert "use O_DIRECT when copying from /dev/zero too"

It turns out running oflag=direct against the LVM snapshot fails for an IO error every time.  Works fine against the regular volume, but fails on snapshot.

This reverts commit 1405a6440d646524d41adfed4fc1344948e2871f

commit_message:
Updates tearDown() to release instance objects

This change fixes the bug by releasing the objects of the instance
of class QuantumDbPluginV2TestCase. Removing unnecessary objects
explicitly reduces the memory required by unit tests.

Fixes bug 1065276

Change-Id: Ia003a7718e1aedc4e4c8fb02b723f4a511ebc319

commit_message:
Updates clear_db() to unregister models and close session.

fixes bug 1080988

This change fixes the bug by ensuring the metadata and session objects
are properly cleaned up by clear_db(). Using the proper calls reduces
the memory required by unit tests.

Change-Id: I1d1802b642eff83b7f96211608195afaf68e855a
