a possible solution to Alan's comment is posted here: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/16566/

feedback welcome, as I'm not sure if there's a more standard way of approaching this."}, {'account_id': 1247, 'date': '2012-11-27 06:12:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

This is a big, scarey-looking patch and the only info that makes it sound like a "high-impact, user-visible issue" is the "It has performance implications" comment in the bug report

Honestly, to consider something like this for stable/folsom, I think we'd need to know that this is causing true user-visible performance problems for real-world use cases'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-27 06:12:54.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

I agree with you that this is a risky patch. There are performance problems when accessing the database and quotas are being used.
I would tend to wait a bit.
Alan's comment is in place and also concerning.
Let me get back to the comments and update as soon as there is some relevant input.
Agree that we should hold on this for now."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-27 06:12:54.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

[{'created': '2012-11-27 06:12:54.000000000', 'message': "Use DB count to get resource counts.

Fixes bug 1075369.

During quota check we used to simply retrieve the entire collection
of resources from the database, then counting them in Python. This
patch introduces a specialized _get_collection_count() method, which
instead take advantage of the DB's built-in count capabilities.

In order to take advantage of this, plugins can now implement
get_*_count() methods for their resources. This is used (if present)
by the quota checking function.

Patch incorporates review feedback from Dan W, Alex Xu, Zhongyue Luo,
Edgar Magana, Akihiro Motoki and gongysh.

commit_message:
Use DB count to get resource counts.

Fixes bug 1075369.

During quota check we used to simply retrieve the entire collection
of resources from the database, then counting them in Python. This
patch introduces a specialized _get_collection_count() method, which
instead take advantage of the DB's built-in count capabilities.

In order to take advantage of this, plugins can now implement
get_*_count() methods for their resources. This is used (if present)
by the quota checking function.

Patch incorporates review feedback from Dan W, Alex Xu, Zhongyue Luo,
Edgar Magana, Akihiro Motoki and gongysh.

Change-Id: I87e2d0294e116e8147fed2ee90c9eb0cf1a54362

commit_message:
Add module for loading specific classes

This adds loadables.py which contains code that is to be shared by
scheduling filtering and weighing in Nova and Cinder.  This is
cherry-picked from Nova (Change I1b217dc2bc2d1dc2235c8251318d06b46597e8f4)

Original commit message:

" ...
Most of this code originated from nova/scheduler/filters/__init__.py
(which was copied from nova/api extension loading).

This makes it more generic so that it can be shared. Note that this
functionality is quite different than the generic plugin manager that
exists in openstack-common. That code could not be used here without
some significant changes. It also seems pretty overkill for the
functionality required by scheduling filtering and weighing."

Change-Id: I7deeb0b6c78e4c81a41312eb9108ca1557ed71aa

We need to avoid trying O_DIRECT with virtual
devices like /dev/zero and /dev/urandom etc.
as it's not supported there, which because of
our later check, would cause O_DIRECT to be
not applied to the output device either.

Related to bug 937694
Possibly related to bug 1023755
Change-Id: I034d8345c3d00689c1f1fffcc2c110735c49ee01

commit_message:
use O_DIRECT when copying from /dev/zero too

We need to avoid trying O_DIRECT with virtual
devices like /dev/zero and /dev/urandom etc.
as it's not supported there, which because of
our later check, would cause O_DIRECT to be
not applied to the output device either.

Related to bug 937694
Possibly related to bug 1023755
Change-Id: I034d8345c3d00689c1f1fffcc2c110735c49ee01

    instance instead of just an instance UUID.  This reduces db access
    required by the compute nodes.  The scheduler code needed some work here
    as well since it wasn't using the compute rpcapi for calling

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-26 08:15:35.000000000', 'message': 'Clean up unused methods in scheduler/driver

The cast_to_volume_host() and cast_to_host() methods have not been
used since compute RPC API is introduced.  This patch removes these

commit_message:
Clean up unused methods in scheduler/driver

The cast_to_volume_host() and cast_to_host() methods have not been
used since compute RPC API is introduced.  This patch removes these
methods and the coresponding tests as well.

Change-Id: Icd2b4b2245cc7662c8dcb6fd35d6c33b77d0429b

commit_message:
Update kernel_id and ramdisk_id while rebuilding instance

While rebuilding an instances if kernel_id and ramdisk_id associated
with new image_ref then update instances table for instance_id
with the new kernel and ramdisk.

Fixes bug 1060925

Change-Id: I07dfdbed8580411adea14fd6c5be1a9569a7a021
(cherry picked from commit c781e90929a6b3c39c0528a864cf560a5a8999e2)

commit_message:
Fix live migration volume assignment.

In pre_live_migration volumes should
get assigned (self.volume_api.initialize_connection)
to the live migration target host.
In post_live_migration the volumes should get
unassigned (self.volume_api.terminate_connection)
from the live migration source host.

Fixes bug 1066887

Change-Id: Ic2db456cd5efbdf15db92f843c92230489efc551
(cherry picked from commit 2543705986789658725aac808e85e2cb638ea3dd)

commit_message:
Deallocate network if instance is deleted in spawn

If the instance is deleted while the virt driver is spawning, an
InstanceNotFound exception is raised and caught in compute to prevent it
from being rescheduled. This also deallocates the network to prevent
leaking interfaces/mac/ips.

* Fixes LP1068716

Change-Id: I991f5956facf7b105faea137d4a5b48897e68ae6
(cherry picked from commit c27558518800322bd13de5d6bd58bffba4e1a92f)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 01:15:33.000000000', 'message': 'libvirt: persist volume attachments into config

When you attach a volume to a running instance, only the running
xml is updated in libvirt. This is due to the usage of the
VIRT_DOMAIN_AFFECT_CURRENT flag passed to attach device. What we
really want is to affect both the config and the running xml. There
is no combination of flags that works in all states, so we explicitly
set the right combination of flags depending on the running state
of the vm.

Includes a test to test_virt_drivers to ensure the flags are passed
correctly.

Fixes bug 1071069

Change-Id: I1992748b08daf99cf03dfeb0937ad42457fff1a3
(cherry picked from commit 814e7f8c827aa21a87a62594d5b6413bb49e31e1)
'}]
commit_message:
libvirt: persist volume attachments into config

When you attach a volume to a running instance, only the running
xml is updated in libvirt. This is due to the usage of the
VIRT_DOMAIN_AFFECT_CURRENT flag passed to attach device. What we
really want is to affect both the config and the running xml. There
is no combination of flags that works in all states, so we explicitly
set the right combination of flags depending on the running state
of the vm.

Includes a test to test_virt_drivers to ensure the flags are passed
correctly.

Fixes bug 1071069

Change-Id: I1992748b08daf99cf03dfeb0937ad42457fff1a3
(cherry picked from commit 814e7f8c827aa21a87a62594d5b6413bb49e31e1)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 00:44:07.000000000', 'message': 'Always use bdm in instance_block_mapping on Xen

It doesn't seem that Xen will set the 'root_device_name' property on
instances.  This is causing instance_block_mapping to return early
without evaluating the bdm before returning the list of device_names
in use.  I'm not sure why instance_block_mapping does this
(optimization?) but on Xen at least it seems that it should not.

Added a check for Xen compute_driver flag in instance_block_mapping to
"guess" the root_device_name (similarlly to what is done in
compute.utils for swap and ephemeral).

fixes bug #1061944

Change-Id: If5b1a2b7377232c78f0629a3624552ecf6ceb0ee
(cherry picked from commit 07845ad68f83952bbae36b4b115ff6c433e81fa3)
'}]
commit_message:
Always use bdm in instance_block_mapping on Xen

It doesn't seem that Xen will set the 'root_device_name' property on
instances.  This is causing instance_block_mapping to return early
without evaluating the bdm before returning the list of device_names
in use.  I'm not sure why instance_block_mapping does this
(optimization?) but on Xen at least it seems that it should not.

Added a check for Xen compute_driver flag in instance_block_mapping to
"guess" the root_device_name (similarlly to what is done in
compute.utils for swap and ephemeral).

fixes bug #1061944

Change-Id: If5b1a2b7377232c78f0629a3624552ecf6ceb0ee
(cherry picked from commit 07845ad68f83952bbae36b4b115ff6c433e81fa3)

commit_message:
Convert some existing templates to YAML format.

This is the result of running:
python tools/cfn-json2yaml templates/
and then cleaning up by hand to be more consistant, readable and
maintainable.

The following templates are enforced to parse to identical stacks
in the unit tests so any fundamental change to one must be made
to the other.

Quantum.template
Quantum.yaml

WordPress_Single_Instance.template
WordPress_Single_Instance.yaml

Change-Id: Ibe05a5c5a7a5bb1861c5f84a3dc41e2d632852fd

commit_message:
For Fn::Join join strings in resolve_static_data

Fn::Join now has some preprocessing in resolve_static_data
where contiguous strings are joined into a single string.

This will allow equivalence tests to pass when comparing
JSON templates to hand-tidied YAML

Change-Id: I49fb2456388b3fd554ccec00920d7e84f6998183

commit_message:
Set default empty dicts for missing sections

So that the YAML format can be more terse, make empty version and
sections imply the lastest version and an empty dict for the
section content.

Change-Id: Ic8b86065534930852fff1488849dbbbbb6b85243

commit_message:
Read deleted flavors when using to_xml()

[{'created': '2012-11-21 18:49:32.000000000', 'message': "nova-manage doesn't validate key to update the quota

nova-manage doesn't validate the key value supplied to
update the quota, as a result unnecessary records will be
created in db and user will be under the impression that
quota value got updated.
This patch validates the input value given to the key.

fixes bug 1064359
Change-Id: I9928f30881aa2780a23005b5f69aa67a44f314c5
(cherry picked from commit 82d8ffec5b5220039e57685fe4359950d1209b14)
"}]
commit_message:
nova-manage doesn't validate key to update the quota

nova-manage doesn't validate the key value supplied to
update the quota, as a result unnecessary records will be
created in db and user will be under the impression that
quota value got updated.
This patch validates the input value given to the key.

fixes bug 1064359
Change-Id: I9928f30881aa2780a23005b5f69aa67a44f314c5
(cherry picked from commit 82d8ffec5b5220039e57685fe4359950d1209b14)

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 17:30:33.000000000', 'message': "Compute doesn't set the 'host' field in instance

When an instance starts, compute ask the resource manager to check the
compute capabilities. If the compute resources are sufficient, the
resource manager updates the 'host' instance field in the database. But
the local variable 'instance' use by compute manger isn't updated.
So, when compute manager asks the network manager to allocate a network
for the instance, the 'host' instance field is null.

Some compute tests doesn't update the local variable instance when
they change some parameter on instance and failed with this patch.

Fixes LP bug #1073600

Change-Id: I842d4814b9eabc6222c68118d8a244b20bb68164
(cherry picked from commit d32d5b252fc6c71a19b5372defb468fee9c57d3a)
"}]
commit_message:
Compute doesn't set the 'host' field in instance

When an instance starts, compute ask the resource manager to check the
compute capabilities. If the compute resources are sufficient, the
resource manager updates the 'host' instance field in the database. But
the local variable 'instance' use by compute manger isn't updated.
So, when compute manager asks the network manager to allocate a network
for the instance, the 'host' instance field is null.

Some compute tests doesn't update the local variable instance when
they change some parameter on instance and failed with this patch.

Fixes LP bug #1073600

Change-Id: I842d4814b9eabc6222c68118d8a244b20bb68164
(cherry picked from commit d32d5b252fc6c71a19b5372defb468fee9c57d3a)

commit_message:
Refactors quantum.api.v2.attributes.py

Logic changes were done for consistency across methods,
removal of redundant code and lower memory consumption.

Fixes bug #1082224

Change-Id: Ie09773d35325bec69ea82b3b59f812af5fa1c4d6

commit_message:
Set instance host field after resource claim

Set the 'host' field on the instance after the resource tracker
on the compute node has accepted the build.

The field is set after resources are confirmed to be available while the
COMPUTE_RESOURCES_SEMAPHORE is held.  The semaphore ensures the
resources usage values will be consistent even if the
update_available_resource periodic task audit runs.

bug 1060255

(cherry picked from commit 5fd7a9dba127bae812333196a5fa48a933212aeb)

Also includes the following bugfix to the original patch:

Set host prior to allocating network information.

Make sure 'host' field on the instance is set before allocating
network information.

bug 1065004

(cherry picked from commit 2649f14673f8ef5ca257583f1cdf5fe57d4734b9)
Change-Id: I92105ec14924960ac8ef7ca8c810783085314e10

[{'created': '2012-11-21 22:22:09.000000000', 'message': 'Save exceptions earlier in finish_resize

Fixes bug 1071595

When catching exceptions, _quota_rollback is called before we save an
exception for re-raising later.  Also: we should ignore any possible
exceptions from _quota_rollback so we are sure to set instance to error.

Change-Id: I50cb4879f7dcc13f99fa23a45030b4140dfc326a
(cherry picked from commit 50a0f3efb6cc4ae9c94439eea346828d35080d6c)

commit_message:
Save exceptions earlier in finish_resize

Fixes bug 1071595

When catching exceptions, _quota_rollback is called before we save an
exception for re-raising later.  Also: we should ignore any possible
exceptions from _quota_rollback so we are sure to set instance to error.

Change-Id: I50cb4879f7dcc13f99fa23a45030b4140dfc326a
(cherry picked from commit 50a0f3efb6cc4ae9c94439eea346828d35080d6c)

commit_message:
Pass elevated context to confirm resize

The actual fix for bug 1071600 is a bit too invasive to backport,
so this is a simpler fix that only changes one line.

Change-Id: I8901056b6216d3d1b945dbc06a66b5354c185076

'}, {'account_id': 1711, 'date': '2012-11-13 04:26:14.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Amazon has a default 20 instances limit, which seems to be a widely accepted reasonable default limit. I'd argue that for testing, one should customize whatever quota limit that fit the scenario. Do you have some references that support the argument (many people hit)? Thanks."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-13 19:49:31.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4:

Yun,

Unfortunately I do not have any references supporting my argument that many people hit the quotas limit, but it is a problem I continuously hit, and I suspect many others do as well.  Perhaps this should be taken to the ML.

While setting an instance limit to 20 seems reasonable (10 is the current default), many of the other defaults seem to be very small, such as quota_cores=20, quota_floating_ips=10, quota_security_groups=10 etc.

I agree that for testing one should adjust the quotas as needed, but that doesn't negate the need for reasonable default values.  The default value should be a value that works for most people in most cases.  I figured a safe default value would be to disable the quotas, as they are an optional feature."}, {'account_id': 1561, 'date': '2012-11-14 02:57:22.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 4: Do not merge

This is a fairly significant change in behavior that people need to be well aware of if it goes in.  Has this been discussed on openstack-dev?  If not, I'd like to see a discussion there first."}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-14 19:44:31.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

Russell,  sounds like a good plan to me.  preparing a email now.'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-14 22:02:49.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

email sent out to start discussion: http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-November/002822.html'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-22 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-22 06:03:02.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-27 01:12:29.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Restored

Bringing back and updating as per ML discussion: 

http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-dev/2012-November/002822.html

As most of the quotas are to prevent assorted types of Denial of Service by consuming all the resources, disabling them by default is undesirable. 

Based on feedback,  I am leaning towards the following default values:


quota_instances=20 # as per amazon
quota_cores=8*20 # == m1.large * quota_instances
quota_ram=16384*20  # == m1.large*quota_instances
quota_floating_ips=20 #==quota_instances
quota_metadata_items=255
quota_injected_files=255
quota_injected_file_content_bytes=10 * 1024
quota_injected_file_path_bytes=255
quota_security_groups=20 # DoS Prevention, do not want unlimited
quota_security_group_rules=20 # DoS prevention, do not want unlimited
quota_key_pairs=1024 # DoS prevention, do not want unlimited'}, {'account_id': 1849, 'date': '2012-11-27 01:17:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 4: Abandoned

After further thought'}]

commit_message:
Disable Quotas by default.

Quotas should not be enabled by default, the previous default values
were too small for even small scale testing, and is a problem many people hit.
New default value for all quotas is unlimited (-1)

Change-Id: I8f23ff5da0193ef9cba9d4f2205c2eba3f5aa671

commit_message:
Add blank nova/virt/baremetal/__init__.py

Without this file in place I was seeing some test failures from the
baremetal unit tests.  The failure was:

    ImportError: No module named baremetal.db

commit_message:
Add SSL support to utils.generate_glance_url().

Since glance now supports SSL, we need to take
this into consideration when generating the URL.
Also updates and adds a test.

A new config option 'glance_protocol' was added
that defaults to 'http' since that's what the
glance options, '*_client_protocol', default to.
Set to 'https' for SSL.

commit_message:
Don't assume parsed JSON in REST API.

This checks to see if the 'template' attribute is a dict.

If not it uses format.parse_to_template to parse it.
Change-Id: Ic9b9ef3e88a33a93d5896277cc3d4da4fd55fc25

Eric: we'll add the get_one optimization in db driver after this one is merged. The rand function is slightly tricky since mysql and postgresql has different names (rand vs random). 

Jay: For now we do not use the directory format for driver code arrangement. It's far less complicated than the virt driver, so everything in a simple flat directory seems acceptable.

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-08-06 16:48:26.000000000', 'message': "Add pluggable membership monitoring APIs

Summary:
* provide a pluggable ServiceGroup  monitoring API
* refactor the old DB-based implementation to the new API

Currently nova compute nodes periodically write to the database (every
10 seconds by default) to report their liveness.  This implementation
factors out this functionality and make it a set of abstract internal
APIs with a pluggable backend implementation.  Currently it's named as
ServiceGroup APIs.

With this effort, we are hopeful to see the following benefits:

 * We expect to see more backend implementations in addition to the
default database-based one, such as ZooKeeper (as described in
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/zk-service-heartbeat) or
rabbitmq heartbeat based.

 * We expect the code to live in openstack-common so projects other
than Nova can take advantage of the internal APIs.

 * Lay the foundations to use lower overhead heartbeat mechanisms
which scale better.

 * Other than reporting whether a node in a service group is up or
down, the code may also be used to query for members.  Other parts of
the code could also take advantage of the new APIs. One noteable
example is the MatchMaker in the rpc library, which may even become
redundant. We have been working with Eric at Cloudscaling to see how
this fits with the matchmaker. It is likely that this code will need
to be used, at least by the peer-to-peer based RPC mechanisms, to
implement the new create_worker method.

Co-author: Pavel Kravchenco <kpavel at il dot ibm dot com>
Co-author: Alexey Roytman <roytman at il dot ibm dot com>

Change-Id: I51645687249c75e7776a684f19529a1e78f33a41

default database-based one, such as ZooKeeper (as described in
blueprint zk-service-heartbeat) or rabbitmq heartbeat based.

 * We expect the code to live in openstack-common so projects other
than Nova can take advantage of the internal APIs.

 * Lay the foundations to use lower overhead heartbeat mechanisms
which scale better.

 * Other than reporting whether a node in a service group is up or
down, the code may also be used to query for members.  Other parts of
the code could also take advantage of the new APIs. One noteable
example is the MatchMaker in the rpc library, which may even become
redundant. We have been working with Eric at Cloudscaling to see how
this fits with the matchmaker. It is likely that this code will need
to be used, at least by the peer-to-peer based RPC mechanisms, to
implement the new create_worker method.

commit_message:
Add pluggable ServiceGroup monitoring APIs

Summary:
* provide a pluggable ServiceGroup monitoring API
* refactor the old DB-based implementation to the new API

Currently nova compute nodes periodically write to the database (every
10 seconds by default) to report their liveness.  This implementation
factors out this functionality and make it a set of abstract internal
APIs with a pluggable backend implementation.  Currently it's named as
ServiceGroup APIs.

With this effort, we are hopeful to see the following benefits:

 * We expect to see more backend implementations in addition to the
default database-based one, such as ZooKeeper (as described in
blueprint zk-service-heartbeat) or rabbitmq heartbeat based.

 * We expect the code to live in openstack-common so projects other
than Nova can take advantage of the internal APIs.

 * Lay the foundations to use lower overhead heartbeat mechanisms
which scale better.

 * Other than reporting whether a node in a service group is up or
down, the code may also be used to query for members.  Other parts of
the code could also take advantage of the new APIs. One noteable
example is the MatchMaker in the rpc library, which may even become
redundant. We have been working with Eric at Cloudscaling to see how
this fits with the matchmaker. It is likely that this code will need
to be used, at least by the peer-to-peer based RPC mechanisms, to
implement the new create_worker method.

DocImpact: new config options

Co-authored-by: Pavel Kravchenco <kpavel@il.ibm.com>
Co-authored-by: Alexey Roytman <roytman@il.ibm.com>

Change-Id: I51645687249c75e7776a684f19529a1e78f33a41

commit_message:
Raise NotImplementedError in dns_driver.DNSDriver.

Updates dns_driver.DNSDriver so that we raise NotImplementedError
instead of returning empty result sets or passing. Since this
class is the default dns_driver for Nova it can be quite
confusing when it returns empty results (which actually
causes some HTTP 500 errors as well).

Also updates several test suites to use MiniDNS instead
(which is meant for testing) including some additional
cleanup to remove the dnstest.txt file.

Ported code originally from Dan Prince
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/11815/

Fix slight style issue. Add a log.warn in addition to
throwing an exception in minidns. Add an ignore of the
said exception in manager.

Looks like we need to add tempfile to get past smoke
tests!!

Fixes LP Bug #1040236 #1081750

Change-Id: If7719cec762e1a1da58e99f947e50082e65b4d8d

commit_message:
Allow setting x-image-meta-store through shell on image creation

Add a command line arg "--store" to "glance image-create" so users
can specify a store other than the default on image creation.

Change-Id: Icf9a894b08e405d6884964b3cfaa80250e85ed71

https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10:

I too found the use of locals to be error prone.
Anyway, I have to say that often when submitting patches for Quantum and other Openstack projects I have been told to use locals() if I there is more than one format specifier in the literal string.

I don't have a strong point or bias. It all boils down to choosing a convention. If the convention is that there's no convention that we should just let this patch merge!"}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Thanks for addressing the comments.

My stance is neutral whether we should use locals() or not and it never becomes a blocking issue to merge a patch in my view.

I agree that it is difficult to detect forgetting to change variable names when changing names. On the other hand, it is useful in case where there are many (3 or 4) parameters included.

It is sorry if my comment is confusing to you.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: (1 inline comment)

'}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:27:25.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 10: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

(2 inline comments)

Hi good job here. But I don't like locals() way.
Maybe other guys will agree with it. I wait for their view points."}, {'account_id': 2874, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10:

hi, Robin, actually, I have confuse with locals() too. If we use locals(), after we change the variable name, we will forget update the log message.'}, {'account_id': 5754, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 10.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-26 22:27:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 10: Verified

'}, {'account_id': 612, 'date': '2012-11-24 06:37:35.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

perhaps add links from the sections other than default (eg conductor) back to their intro sections?'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-11-24 16:01:53.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Tom:

I struggled with this. The challenge here is that the other sections don't have documentation yet. I've written some documentation on trusted compute pools, but it hasn't landed yet (it's https://review.openstack.org/16783). 

There's no documentation about the nova-conductor service yet, I just filed a bug about that: https://bugs.launchpad.net/openstack-manuals/+bug/1082689

I agree we should have links there, but I'd prefer not to have to wait until those sections are there before getting this merged in."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-24 21:06:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: No score

Starting gate jobs.
https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 1627, 'date': '2012-11-24 21:06:15.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-24 21:06:37.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}, {'account_id': 964, 'date': '2012-11-26 21:11:34.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

So the sections are now required, but only for trusted computing and conductor?'}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-11-26 21:47:00.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Anne:

The [DEFAULT] section has always been required, but the trusted computing and conductor features have added new sections.'}]

Some updates to the section that documents nova.conf.

Describes the .ini format, including supported sections.

Add examples for each configuration option types.

Describe variable substitution.

Describe what to do if nova.conf is not in the standard location.

'}]
commit_message:
Update nova.conf section

Some updates to the section that documents nova.conf.

Describes the .ini format, including supported sections.

Add examples for each configuration option types.

Describe variable substitution.

Describe what to do if nova.conf is not in the standard location.

Change-Id: I8751eec2e5964b6e49ac5cb0d9a345b7fde59f9a

commit_message:
Rename instance_info_cache unique key constraints.

Rename (via drop and recreate) the instance_uuid unique
constraints on the instance_info_cache table so they reflect
the column change name (UUID conversion) we complete in Folsom.

Fixes LP Bug #1080837.

Change-Id: I9dd01ebc896c1d7b51c212980e48db16bad18dec

commit_message:
Add eventlet db_pool use for mysql

This adds the use of eventlet's db_pool module so that we can make mysql
calls without blocking the whole process.

New config options are introduced:

sql_dbpool_enable -- Enables the use of eventlet's db_pool
sql_min_pool_size -- Set the minimum number of SQL connections

The default for sql_dbpool_enable is False for now, so there is
no forced behavior changes for those using mysql.  sql_min_pool_size
is defaulted to 1 to match behavior if not using db_pool.

Adds a new test module for our sqlalchemy code, testing this new option
as much as is possible without requiring mysql server to be running.

DocImpact

commit_message:
Add an image repo proxy that handles notifications

This patch hides image notifications inside the the domain layer. This
way, eventually the controller won't have to keep track of
notifications.

Part of implementing bp:glance-domain-logic-layer

Change-Id: Ie763a50ea416cae66b8015162dcdb5232a4e0a1d

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-26 19:28:14.000000000', 'message': 'pip-requires fix boto version

Boto version added to pip-requires is wrong - we need a version containing
the commit discussed under https://github.com/boto/boto/pull/742, which is
only included in boto>=2.4.0

Change-Id: Iaaa61f306d4035e63ca3f7a0eafe2d5715585f16
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>
'}]
commit_message:
pip-requires fix boto version

Boto version added to pip-requires is wrong - we need a version containing
the commit discussed under https://github.com/boto/boto/pull/742, which is
only included in boto>=2.4.0

Change-Id: Iaaa61f306d4035e63ca3f7a0eafe2d5715585f16
Signed-off-by: Steven Hardy <shardy@redhat.com>

@dprince - SmokeStack is going to have to be updated before this patch lands.  This will be the first patch that uses nova-conductor.  There are two things you can do to make things keep working:

1) Short term transition:

Add this to nova.conf:

[conductor]
use_local=True

2) Long term

Update test deployment to run the nova-conductor service.  Defaults for all config options should be fine.  If you want to look at them, see nova/conductor/api.py.'}, {'account_id': 4393, 'date': '2012-11-19 23:02:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 11:

Several tests require changes to ensure that the conductor service
is started before they ask the compute manager to do instance
updates.

This also incorporates some fixes to code that assumes the instance
is anything other than a primitive dict.

of the timestamps by converting to strings. After passing the instances
through jsonutils.to_primitive(), the strings are a bit different.

commit_message:
Make compute manager use nova-conductor for instance_update

Several tests require changes to ensure that the conductor service
is started (or set to local mode) before they ask the compute
manager to do instance updates.

Changes were required to some of the tests that check the value
of the timestamps by converting to strings. After passing the instances
through jsonutils.to_primitive(), the strings are a bit different.

Change-Id: I660e471178f3e5b36c4be27d47047fb4e4e1f851

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-21 19:54:24.000000000', 'message': 'Fix multi-node resource race bug

Node should not be set on the instance until the compute resource
tracker accepted the instance claim.  Otherwise there is a race
where the update_available_resource process can erroneously over-report
the usage of the compute node.

bug 1081351

Change-Id: Id3086585a99350abbab387932e689825b33ab6b5
'}, {'created': '2012-11-24 05:41:53.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup compute multi-node assignment of node

Move assignment of the node field on the instance to the compute host
to be more consistent with how the host field is assigned and handled
by the resource tracker.

Change-Id: Id3086585a99350abbab387932e689825b33ab6b5
'}, {'created': '2012-11-25 16:47:00.000000000', 'message': 'Cleanup compute multi-node assignment of node

Move assignment of the node field on the instance to the compute host
to be more consistent with how the host field is assigned and handled
by the resource tracker.

Change-Id: Id3086585a99350abbab387932e689825b33ab6b5
'}]
commit_message:
Cleanup compute multi-node assignment of node

Move assignment of the node field on the instance to the compute host
to be more consistent with how the host field is assigned and handled
by the resource tracker.

Change-Id: Id3086585a99350abbab387932e689825b33ab6b5

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-20 17:55:56.000000000', 'message': "Remove redundant db.volume_update() in volume manager create_volume()

Since scheduler has already updated db to set the 'host' field and
recorded 'scheduled_at' time, it's not necessary to do db.volume_update()
again in volume manager create_volume() method.  Also let volume api
to update db when creating volume from snapshot while snapshot_same_host
is true, thus the behavior is consistent (updating db when placement
decision is made).

Change-Id: I43aaee8e2a5d0ceadb98bd608cc147467488349e
"}]
commit_message:
Remove redundant db.volume_update() in volume manager create_volume()

Since scheduler has already updated db to set the 'host' field and
recorded 'scheduled_at' time, it's not necessary to do db.volume_update()
again in volume manager create_volume() method.  Also let volume api
to update db when creating volume from snapshot while snapshot_same_host
is true, thus the behavior is consistent (updating db when placement
decision is made).

Change-Id: I43aaee8e2a5d0ceadb98bd608cc147467488349e

commit_message:
Adds API for bulk creation/deletion of floating IPs

This adds an extension that provides a REST API for the bulk creation,
deletion and listing of floating IPs. The interface is accessed via

/v2/{tenant_id}/os-floating-ips-bulk

This forms part of the work to provide APIs for functionality currently
implemented by nova-manage that needs direct db access so nova-manage
can eventually be removed

Implements: blueprint apis-for-nova-manage
DocImpact

Change-Id: I621e2b070a896f7230cdf3f26f78ded85e72cf16

commit_message:
Removing unnecessary setUp()/tearDown() in SecurityGroupsTestCase

This patch removes not required setUp()/tearDown() functions in
SecurityGroupsTestCase. The functions are almost identical in
test_db_plugin.QuantumDbPluginV2TestCase. Only difference is initializing
ext_mgr which is done by SecurityGroupDBTestCase.setUp().

And redundant inheritance of unittest2.TestCase for SecurityGroupsTestCase
is fixed.

Change-Id: I50d8efd047e23d02d76b8f38b75c730b75bb96ce

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-26 16:19:52.000000000', 'message': "Stop using cfg's internal implementation details

The fact that a cfg opt register using register_opt() is available via
the command line is actually a bug (see bug #1082279).

Also, using the _cli_values attribute is clearly poking into private
implementation details.

Fix both issues by registering the opt using register_cli_opt() and
accessing its value the normal way.

Change-Id: If170dcd96daae5b4c3d7cdebed914df417c2209b
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using cfg's internal implementation details

The fact that a cfg opt register using register_opt() is available via
the command line is actually a bug (see bug #1082279).

Also, using the _cli_values attribute is clearly poking into private
implementation details.

Fix both issues by registering the opt using register_cli_opt() and
accessing its value the normal way.

Change-Id: If170dcd96daae5b4c3d7cdebed914df417c2209b

commit_message:
Return size as int from store get call

The size value needs to be comparable as integers, which
a string won't give us. This returns size as an integer
from a call to the 'get' method of our known stores.

Change-Id: I08ff9c673735eeb5943745ae4a27d6e241101230

commit_message:
Add pep8 ignore options to run_tests.sh

Updates run_tests.sh so it uses the same pep8 ignore options
we do for tox. This fixes a slew of pep8 errors that will occur
with recent pep8 releases using Glance.

Change-Id: I0a9bb237f75eb307ee433cc6b1c5f78cd71dd02e

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 12:28:17.000000000', 'message': 'Creates nova endpoint when n-api is enabled.

Fixes bug 1081975

Nova endpoint in keystone was registered if n-cpu is enabled. However it is
a usual case where n-cpu runs on a different host in multi-node setup and
it results in no endpoint for nova. n-api is a better condition since nova-api
and keystone usually run on a same host.

Change-Id: Ic097e1c3bd30798d9d3c5fb76023fbdb3ae189d9
'}]
commit_message:
Creates nova endpoint when n-api is enabled.

Fixes bug 1081975

Nova endpoint in keystone was registered if n-cpu is enabled. However it is
a usual case where n-cpu runs on a different host in multi-node setup and
it results in no endpoint for nova. n-api is a better condition since nova-api
and keystone usually run on a same host.

Change-Id: Ic097e1c3bd30798d9d3c5fb76023fbdb3ae189d9

It fixes bug 1082275

The current version of the HyperV Compute driver wasn't returning
CPU information when it reported its resources.

In order to solve it, this patch extracts the cpu properties
from WMI and Win32 calls.

Change-Id: I5c2a89b5e432f4e958354a15582258d4cff83658
"}]
commit_message:
Added cpu_info report to HyperV Compute driver

It fixes bug 1082275

The current version of the HyperV Compute driver wasn't returning
CPU information when it reported its resources.

In order to solve it, this patch extracts the cpu properties
from WMI and Win32 calls.

Change-Id: I5c2a89b5e432f4e958354a15582258d4cff83658

[{'created': '2012-11-16 22:53:26.000000000', 'message': 'Support path search in nova-rootwrap

Look for the specified executable, if it exists, then use that one
if it does not, look in some well known locations and return what
we find. worst case if the executable is not found, just return
the specified path

Fixes bug #1079723

Change-Id: Icb541e7e7f19fd68a193dd8793ab1695990253db
'}]
commit_message:
Support path search in nova-rootwrap

Look for the specified executable, if it exists, then use that one
if it does not, look in some well known locations and return what
we find. worst case if the executable is not found, just return
the specified path

Fixes bug #1079723

Change-Id: Icb541e7e7f19fd68a193dd8793ab1695990253db

[{'created': '2012-11-22 13:27:21.000000000', 'message': 'Remove unused rpc import

commit 2789f144d4776a79551ec7603b292460e08f3518 uses service.py
in openstack-common and changes the collector from a manager into
a Service. The rpc connection creation in CollectorManager is not
called any more. So, remove the unnecessary rpc import.

Change-Id: I710e14beb3485661e8aeeae0792fae68cba48979
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Remove unused rpc import

commit 2789f144d4776a79551ec7603b292460e08f3518 uses service.py
in openstack-common and changes the collector from a manager into
a Service. The rpc connection creation in CollectorManager is not
called any more. So, remove the unnecessary rpc import.

Change-Id: I710e14beb3485661e8aeeae0792fae68cba48979
Signed-off-by: Shane Wang <shane.wang@intel.com>

'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-16 01:49:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

was this motivated by some sort of bug? Just looking for some background."}, {'account_id': 24, 'date': '2012-11-16 02:15:25.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

Actually it was from some reading I was doing about optimizing vms'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-16 02:17:32.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

i'd like for us to come up with a general way for us to extend the libvirt xml without having to add flags for every possible combination. Maybe Daniel has some thoughts on how we could do such a thing."}, {'account_id': 1525, 'date': '2012-11-16 07:05:23.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Even if we do not go all the way with libvirt options being completely dynamic, I think this should be a general "kernel_args" or similar option.

Also, the IO scheduler can be changed via /sys, unless I am missing something.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-11-16 09:26:07.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I'm also not really convinced that we want to add yet another global Nova config option just for this, particularly if it only works for guests which are booted with standalone kernel files. The guest admin can control this themselves by setting tunables in sysfs for their disks if desired.

What I could see as worthwhile is the ability to associate a "kernel_args" metadata parameter with each kernel image that a user uploads to glance.'}, {'account_id': 1779, 'date': '2012-11-16 09:29:13.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

@vish: if booting from an external kernel image, the libvirt XML schema already allows for a generic "<cmdline>" arg for arbitrary kernel boot parameters'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-19 01:34:09.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

Daniel: I'm actually referring to a way for deployers to tweak libvirt.xml without having to add a bunch of config options to nova. We used to have a template that they could tweak but now everything is generated in code."}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-26 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1:

code review expired after 1 week of no activity after a negative review, it can be restored using the `Restore Change` button under the Patch Set on the web interface'}, {'account_id': 9, 'date': '2012-11-26 06:03:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-15 21:35:54.000000000', 'message': 'Add libvirt_io_scheduler option.

Allow the user to change the default I/O scehduler
for a libvirt instance, by specifying
"elevator=" in the kernel command line when the isntance
starts. If there is no specific io_scheduler chosen
the default by the kernel will be used.

See the linux kernel documeation for more information.
(Documentation/block/switching-sched.txt)

Change-Id: I410b8b0c0d6cddf9e201d0e62826cfd10903ea63
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Add libvirt_io_scheduler option.

Allow the user to change the default I/O scehduler
for a libvirt instance, by specifying
"elevator=" in the kernel command line when the isntance
starts. If there is no specific io_scheduler chosen
the default by the kernel will be used.

See the linux kernel documeation for more information.
(Documentation/block/switching-sched.txt)

Change-Id: I410b8b0c0d6cddf9e201d0e62826cfd10903ea63
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>

commit_message:
User can switch between rsyslog and rotated file log. By default, if log_facility is in configuration file, then use syslog; if log log_facility, but have logconfig, then the rotated file log will be used

Change-Id: I8f1adeed2ebc34e975eb45909ab5f3053c9172d8

However, metering computer pollster need to get all instance
in one host. Grant admin privilege to metering computer pollster is
not very secure. Change this requirement to be policy-based.

This is a minor changes to the API, and backward compatibility can
be achieved through policy setting.

Change-Id: I8f1f064434ab12b6c0cd636f84dfc1b6a9b2fc90

Change-Id: I8f1f064434ab12b6c0cd636f84dfc1b6a9b2fc90
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
"}, {'created': '2012-11-20 14:00:10.000000000', 'message': 'Change all tenants servers listing as policy-based

Currently when list servers from all tenants (i.e. --all-tenants is set as 1
when "nova list"), privilege is required.

However, computer pollster in ceilometer need to get all instances from
all tenants in one host. Granting admin privilege to the pollster is
not very secure.

All tenants servers list should be policy-based, instead of requiring
admin privelege.

There is one potential backward compatibility. With all_tenants specified,
non-admin accounts will get back owned servers only without this patch,
however it will get policy exception now if policy checking failed. IMHO
the new behaviour makes more sense.

Change-Id: I8f1f064434ab12b6c0cd636f84dfc1b6a9b2fc90
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>
'}]
commit_message:
Change all tenants servers listing as policy-based

Currently when list servers from all tenants (i.e. --all-tenants is set as 1
when "nova list"), privilege is required.

However, computer pollster in ceilometer need to get all instances from
all tenants in one host. Granting admin privilege to the pollster is
not very secure.

All tenants servers list should be policy-based, instead of requiring
admin privelege.

There is one potential backward compatibility. With all_tenants specified,
non-admin accounts will get back owned servers only without this patch,
however it will get policy exception now if policy checking failed. IMHO
the new behaviour makes more sense.

Change-Id: I8f1f064434ab12b6c0cd636f84dfc1b6a9b2fc90
Signed-off-by: Yunhong, Jiang <yunhong.jiang@intel.com>

commit_message:
Use more specific SecurityGroupHandler calls

Instead of calling trigger_security_group_members_refresh,
have NetworkManager and derived classes call more specific
methods when an instance is created or destroyed.

Methods such as the trigger_instance_add_security_group_refresh
and trigger_instance_remove_security_group_refresh,
instead of just having trigger_security_group_members_refresh
get called and forcing implementors to try and figure out if
it's an add or delete

blueprint trigger-specific-sgh-functions

Change-Id: Iefef9180972db3277ae6fc0c2c9abf518b00e2a4

commit_message:
Convert all existing templates to YAML format.

This is the result of running:
python tools/cfn-json2yaml templates/

These files could benefit from further tidying up by hand, especially
UserData Fn::Join sections.

Change-Id: Ibe05a5c5a7a5bb1861c5f84a3dc41e2d632852fc

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-26 03:28:34.000000000', 'message': "Don't force run_tests.sh pep8 only to use -N.

Previously running run_tests.sh -p would *always* run
outside of the virtual environment. This commit makes -p
work equally well with -N (no-virtual-env) and -V (virtual-env).

Change-Id: I214404e85af2122b2ea7330e6496848a1e0d7ddf
"}]
commit_message:
Don't force run_tests.sh pep8 only to use -N.

Previously running run_tests.sh -p would *always* run
outside of the virtual environment. This commit makes -p
work equally well with -N (no-virtual-env) and -V (virtual-env).

Change-Id: I214404e85af2122b2ea7330e6496848a1e0d7ddf

commit_message:
Parse all templates with format.parse_to_template

It can no longer be assumed that a template string is in JSON format.

Change-Id: Id43b82a25e62f7c7868c1c51556c5bde94e7b132

commit_message:
Module for converting JSON to YAML, and parsing both

convert_json_to_yaml is a utility function used for tests and file conversion
utilities.

parse_to_template will take any string, infer the format, and parse to a
python structure. Currently it assumes the file is JSON if it starts with '{'
otherwise it attempts to parse it as YAML.

Change-Id: If15ccdaf912693f76b74bb1fe879145af1cb36b1

commit_message:
Add packages and versions in response to grizzly-1

- Paste is now PasteDeploy
- boto is now an explicit requirement
- python-glanceclient replaces removed glance client
- added PyYAML for new YAML format

Change-Id: I59e11a45f7cc77007e259e5dd1b216e691c5f116

commit_message:
Allow VMs to be resumed after a hypervisor reboot

Fixes bug 1052696.

Update the compute manager to pass network_info and block_device_info
to the driver.resume() and update all virtualization drivers to accept
the new arguments.

For libvirt, change resume() to use _create_domain_and_network()
rather than _create_domain(). This eliminates the assumption that the
network and block device connections remained in place from the period
between the VM being suspended and resumed.  Instead, all the
networking and block connections will be rebuilt on resume (in case
they are missing) as is the case after a hypervisor reboot.

Change-Id: I6e19ec42f7e929678abce8f276c0a6e91f1fa8af

Truncate large console logs in libvirt.

Resolves bug 1081436 where they were returning a 5.5gb console log
to the user.

Metadata service, user data and cloud-init

subject: Removes quantum.common.utils.str_uuid()
messages:
[{'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/2/check/gate-quantum-merge/2613 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/2/check/gate-quantum-docs/1852 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/2/check/gate-quantum-pep8/2472 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/2/check/gate-quantum-python26/2242 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/2/check/gate-quantum-python27/2243 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I prefer to using a wrapper function to generate an UUID.

There are some variants of UUID (version 1, 3, 4, 5). In OpenStack uuid4 is usually used. By using a wrapper function to generate an UUID, we can easily ensure that version 4 of UUID is generated for an ID.

Nova has a similar wrapper function in nova.utils (though it is not necessarily used in everywhere)."}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

Hi,
I am in favour of leaving the wrapper function. This may enable us to make use of different implementations in the future.
Thanks
Gary"}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 2.'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

garyk, akihiro

As of today Nova no longer uses wrappers to generate uuids. The str_uuid provides no value other than inconsistency of code in which you can see now in the master branch. If there were to be any problems by using the standard uuid module or by changing our identifier type, I assume it is because our tests scripts isn't perfect enough. I personally think it is still better to use the uuid module directly rather than a one-liner wrapper. However, this is only my opinion. If most of you disagree, I will concur."}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Works for me

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/check/gate-quantum-merge/2791 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/check/gate-quantum-docs/2030 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/check/gate-quantum-pep8/2650 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/check/gate-quantum-python26/2420 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/check/gate-quantum-python27/2421 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: No score

Starting gate jobs.
https://jenkins.openstack.org/zuul/status'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Verified

Build successful

- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/gate/gate-quantum-merge/2813 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/gate/gate-quantum-docs/2052 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/gate/gate-quantum-pep8/2672 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/gate/gate-quantum-python26/2442 : SUCCESS
- http://logs.openstack.org/16143/3/gate/gate-quantum-python27/2443 : SUCCESS
'}, {'account_id': 841, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer); Approved

Thanks.
I like this approach using uuidutils of openstack-common.'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi,
I do not see it as two different functions. It is just how the wrapper is implemented. This touches quite a lot of files. My two cents is that if you change the implementation of the wrapper then you achieve you goal. Quantum also gains in 2 respects:-
1. We are using common code
2. Minimal changes to files (we are maintaining a stable Folsom release and back ports are considerably simpler when the code has not undergone many changes). Minimal changes is also less risk
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3: Looks good to me (core reviewer)

Hi,
I am not convinced by do not see any harm in the change.
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1653, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

Hi,
Have you considered just replacing in str(uuid.uuid4()) str_uuid() with uuidutils.generate_uuid()? This will certainly simply the change and you can achieve your goal?
Thanks
Gary'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

garyk

I see your point that changing str_uuid would result in less change and less risk.

However, that only results in consistency of behavior. What about consistency of code?

Are we also going to change the implementation of quantum.tests.test_api_v2._uuid() which is called three times more than str_uuid()?

What if a new module creates its own indirection of generate_uuid() or directly uses uuidutils directly in the future?

My point is why allow variants of uuidutils (which each one would also require unitests) and increase code complexity when we can directly use uuidutils?'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 3:

garyk:
Why should there be two different functions that create uuids? Is it the possibility that this could break something that you are worried about?'}, {'account_id': 1994, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 5494, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

New patchset patch-id matches previous patchset, but commit message has changed.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'content': 'Change has been successfully merged into the git repository.'}]

[{'created': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove all uuid wrapper functions

The uuid generating wrappers induce inconsistancy and
an extra layer of indirection
The uuid standard module should be directly used and properly tested

Removed str_uuid in quantum.commons.utils
Replaced str_uuid and _uuid to str(uuid.uuid4())

Change-Id: Ib09b070bfa1de4435c831d1d3c0fb0b0d12011bd
'}, {'created': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'message': 'Removes quantum.common.utils.str_uuid()

Replaced str_uuid() with openstack.common.uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Fixes bug #1082236

Change-Id: Ib09b070bfa1de4435c831d1d3c0fb0b0d12011bd
'}, {'created': '2012-11-25 20:33:50.000000000', 'message': 'Remove all uuid wrapper functions

The uuid generating wrappers induce inconsistancy and
an extra layer of indirection
The uuid standard module should be directly used and properly tested

Removed gen_uuid
Replaced gen_uuid and _uuid to str(uuid.uuid4())

Change-Id: Ib09b070bfa1de4435c831d1d3c0fb0b0d12011bd
'}]
commit_message:
Removes quantum.common.utils.str_uuid()

Replaced str_uuid() with openstack.common.uuidutils.generate_uuid()

Fixes bug #1082236

Change-Id: Ib09b070bfa1de4435c831d1d3c0fb0b0d12011bd

commit_message:
Add an image proxy to handle stored image data

When you delete an image, it should delete (or submit a delayed delete
for) the data in the store.

Part of implementing bp:glance-domain-logic-layer

Change-Id: I1ef4d6915a5fed02316b6945c99599511ea0392b

commit_message:
pass static to argv to quantum-debug config parser

fixes bug 1079609

The quantum-debug tests were using the test runners sys.argv instead of
creating a known value.  This fix passes a fake argv to parse.

Change-Id: Iaae7292057b839f64e172504a55034a0d9272918

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-23 12:18:31.000000000', 'message': "nova-dhcpbridge should require the FLAGFILE is set

We always launch dnsmasq with FLAGFILE set, so something is very broken
if FLAGFILE isn't set when nova-dhcpbridge is launched.

Also, the fallback to CONF.dhcpbridge_flagfile is a little strange - at
this point, we haven't parsed any config files so the only possible
value of this config option is its default value.

There's no real need to gracefully handle this condition either - a
KeyError is a straightforward enough error.

Change-Id: I734d7b739f17c8a9ab48d8ba13baacff3f00e1c4
"}]
commit_message:
nova-dhcpbridge should require the FLAGFILE is set

We always launch dnsmasq with FLAGFILE set, so something is very broken
if FLAGFILE isn't set when nova-dhcpbridge is launched.

Also, the fallback to CONF.dhcpbridge_flagfile is a little strange - at
this point, we haven't parsed any config files so the only possible
value of this config option is its default value.

There's no real need to gracefully handle this condition either - a
KeyError is a straightforward enough error.

Change-Id: I734d7b739f17c8a9ab48d8ba13baacff3f00e1c4

commit_message:
Remove stale flags unit tests

The tests in test_flags don't test any Nova specific code. At this point
they just test a fairly random set of cfg use cases that are already
covered by cfg's unit tests.

Change-Id: I752d9676824eb479fcaef2c89a0a42fcfab45f8c

commit_message:
Add keystoneclient to pip-requires

As of I788300449e37ba1732f6482ebce5f480a2c14a41, we pull the auth_token
middleware from keystoneclient. (added to keystoneclient in version 0.2.0)

Change-Id: Ide0d562d96e5e426f9c7e532251efd57a0964f11

commit_message:
Ensures that Endpoint Create does not Break Functionality

Fixes bug#1020248

Not including the optional arguments in "keystone endpoint-create"
leaves them as "None" type variables in code. The "None" variables
cause errors for subsequent functions, which breaks functionality
as described in the bug report.

Change-Id: I6f828344551b81a169209c895db7ea7cde8678b3

commit_message:
Updates tearDown() to release instance objects

This change fixes the bug by releasing the objects of the instance
of class QuantumDbPluginV2TestCase. Removing unnecessary objects
explicitly reduces the memory required by unit tests.

Fixes bug 1065276

Change-Id: Ia003a7718e1aedc4e4c8fb02b723f4a511ebc319

Are we sure there won't be any side-effects to this ? 
Doesn't a 1045 only means the user you tried to login with doesn't have any pass set ? if so, why not simply allocating one for it ?"}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-11-15 02:04:17.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

Rafique:

My guess is the 1045 error occurs because the authentication request is matching against those anonymous accounts, which don't have passwords set on them.

I need to do some more digging here to get a better sense of the error condition. I'm going to set this to WIP until I get a better understanding of it."}, {'account_id': 321, 'date': '2012-11-15 02:04:42.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: Work In Progress

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-11 05:02:59.000000000', 'message': 'Delete anonymous MySQL accounts

Having anonymous MySQL accounts (which are caused by default) can cause services like keystone to fail to authenticate against the MySQL database.

For details, see: http://www.tikalk.com/alm/blog/solution-mysql-error-1045-access-denied-userlocalhost-breaks-openstack

I ran into this as well.

This documents how to remove this anonymous accounts.

Change-Id: I731bd60caca2c4ed417056d93fbae7145eac2734
'}, {'created': '2012-11-11 05:03:37.000000000', 'message': 'Delete anonymous MySQL accounts

Having anonymous MySQL accounts (which are caused by default) can
cause services like keystone to fail to authenticate against the
MySQL database.

For details, see: http://www.tikalk.com/alm/blog/solution-mysql-error-1045-access-denied-userlocalhost-breaks-openstack

I ran into this as well.

This documents how to remove this anonymous accounts.

Change-Id: I731bd60caca2c4ed417056d93fbae7145eac2734
'}]
commit_message:
Delete anonymous MySQL accounts

Having anonymous MySQL accounts (which are caused by default) can
cause services like keystone to fail to authenticate against the
MySQL database.

For details, see: http://www.tikalk.com/alm/blog/solution-mysql-error-1045-access-denied-userlocalhost-breaks-openstack

I ran into this as well.

This documents how to remove this anonymous accounts.

Change-Id: I731bd60caca2c4ed417056d93fbae7145eac2734

commit_message:
Configure guest CPU model with libvirt+KVM

Document how to control the guest CPU model when using libvirt+kvm.

Docs are based on this OpenStack wiki page by Daniel Berrange
http://wiki.openstack.org/LibvirtXMLCPUModel

This functionality was introduced in the Folsom release.

Cherry-picked from https://review.openstack.org/16401

Change-Id: Ic9a82f7f9d477f68b3bfd27f0312e46e434f0651

commit_message:
Add hosts extension to cinderclient.

This adds the hosts extension to Cinder which is similar to
the extension by the same name in Nova.

This extension allows an admin user to check the status of
Cinder services on different hosts.  In addition it also
provides the capability to get host and project specific information
regarding volume count and space allocated for volumes on a specified
host.

Depends on Change: Ic3679cfcd900baecdc2da17e42194cac99c9d422
Implements blueprint cinder-hosts-extension

Change-Id: I4d97e4633bd93265609a5bdf5899fff24c2a12cf

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-22 12:46:19.000000000', 'message': "Remove sitepackages=True from tox.ini

Fixes bug #1082002

With sitepackages=True, I'm seeing the tests fail on my machine because
the older system version of nose gets used.

Looking at other projects, this is only set in the tox:jenkins section
where one exists.

Change-Id: I1ab5f337adf8fc668608146ccb2ab3f2590204be
"}]
commit_message:
Remove sitepackages=True from tox.ini

Fixes bug #1082002

With sitepackages=True, I'm seeing the tests fail on my machine because
the older system version of nose gets used.

Looking at other projects, this is only set in the tox:jenkins section
where one exists.

Change-Id: I1ab5f337adf8fc668608146ccb2ab3f2590204be

commit_message:
raise_on_error parameter shouldn't be passed to task function

Modify the run_periodic_tasks() so that It has known parameters.
Task function has the only parameter 'context'

Bug #1081428

Change-Id: Ibc3da521df3dc47f8c136ade1070112fd5ea1039

subject: Remove sitepackages=True from tox.ini
messages: [{'account_id': 2, 'date': '2012-11-23 21:28:06.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Abandoned'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-23 21:26:10.000000000', 'message': "Remove sitepackages=True from tox.ini

sitepackages=True violates the virtualenv as it causes system versions to
be used instead of testing what's in the pip-requires. We use it in nova
purely because we have no other way to get at the libvirt module. If we can
ever figure out another way around that, we will. It should certainly not
be used elsewhere.

Change-Id: Ieadc69d9872c78e1f53f1fdb17a09fe3f030cbf0
"}]
commit_message:
Remove sitepackages=True from tox.ini

sitepackages=True violates the virtualenv as it causes system versions to
be used instead of testing what's in the pip-requires. We use it in nova
purely because we have no other way to get at the libvirt module. If we can
ever figure out another way around that, we will. It should certainly not
be used elsewhere.

Change-Id: Ieadc69d9872c78e1f53f1fdb17a09fe3f030cbf0

commit_message:
Move global fixture setup into nova/test.py

There are global fixtures that get set up for testing in
nova/tests/__init__.py, even though there is a base test class. As we move
towards parallel testing, we want to convert all of these into proper fixtures.
As a step towards that, move them into nova/test.py so that it's clear that
they are part of the global test setup. From there we'll move them into
proper fixture classes.

Part of blueprint grizzly-testtools

Change-Id: Ia0b0ae380069a212bc20e009d1088c2bad7d9177

commit_message:
Add CONTRIBUTING file.

If the CONTRIBUTING[.md] file exists, Github will show a link to it to
anyone who files an issue on Github or opens a pull request on
Github. This files points folks to the OpenStack wiki page which
provides the proper instructions on how to contribute to OpenStack.

See also <https://github.com/blog/1184-contributing-guidelines>.

Change-Id: I8fef06b71aa993c4c68a1ec92c39a540318aaf31

commit_message:
kombu's fanout_cast_to_server was calling wrong method

Make it call the common amqp method fanout_cast_to_server vs
cast_to_server.

Fixes bug 1074113

(cherry picked from commit b7e697187c)

Change-Id: If06bde93dab94c6030465a5e7ba329d8936c69e3

commit_message:
swift-init will skip uninstalled servers

Check if the bin exists before attempting to report on the status of,
start, or stop the specified server.  It is particullarlly polite to
supress the warning if the server is not installed.

fixes lp bug #1079075

Change-Id: I651ac3c9c9b25bedfad384d950d58c804531d250

'}, {'account_id': 261, 'date': '2012-11-23 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

Even if this patch is ok from a syntax perspective, I think we need to understand a little bit better the implications of passing the auth token down to the plugin.

Among the potential issues, the first things that sprint up to my mind are that we will now have a potentially undefined number of clients validating tokens with keystone, and that the chances of 'leaking' a token are now increased.

I therefore suggest to:
1) Link this patch to a bug on launchpad. This is our standard procedure, and will allows us, among the other things, to keep track of progress and align it with release milestones.
2) Bring the discussion to the Openstack development mailing list, where you can get feedback from the whole community.

I understand this might seem a bit too much for a small patch, but you're touching a very sensible part of the system, which in theory might have side-effects which go beyond the Quantum service itself."}, {'account_id': 447, 'date': '2012-11-23 06:03:05.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: (1 inline comment)

commit_message:
Pass auth token down to plugin.

This change allows plugin to access to the token
sent in the request. This way, plugin can send the
token to the external devices or software that the
plugin needs to talk to so they can authenticate
and access to the sender's identity.

Make auth_tok to auth_token for the sake of
consistency with the Nova code.

Change-Id: I14389b56561eb0c1dfe6f3ee508eb99e91c9b029
Signed-off-by: Tomoe Sugihara <tomoe@midokura.com>

(2 inline comments)

Were you in the Grizzly summit session on db-archiving? We discussed a solution to this problem at some length, which is now written up here:
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/nova/+spec/db-archiving
and here:
https://etherpad.openstack.org/DatabaseArchiving

I see several things wrong with this current implementation, though the work is generally in the right direction. My two big issues with this are:
1) we need to use an actually-unique field to enforce the uniqueness of non-deleted records. This can be done by storing the row `id` in the `deleted` column. Using a timestamp to create uniqueness will break at scale.
2) `deleted_at` behavior does not need to, and should not, be changed, and having this column default to a non-null value, while keeping `deleted` False, is counter-intuitive."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-15 22:23:04.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

commit_message:
Changed default value of deleted_at for all entities in sqlalchemy

Default values of deleted_at will be used to create unique constraints for entries.

Add utcnone() that returns min datetime value which is safe to use instead of None.

Change existing code to make it work with new default value of deleted_at.

Change-Id: I56e798a86107ee0192c30c9c18bca2aa126036db

"}, {'account_id': 5511, 'date': '2012-11-15 12:50:20.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1:

After reading this patch I understood what I56e798a86107ee0192c30c9c18bca2aa126036db was for (they could be sqished together to make it more clear), however I personally do not like this approach to accomplishing a more clear way to indicate duplicates. The reasons are as follows:

* It introduces an arbitrary value in the database that causes even more obfuscation in a place where Null is very clear and explicit.
* It does this in order to save one select database query on 3 Tables one of which is almost never updated and holds relatively few rows (flavors) which is a questionable benefit imho
* It does make some code a bit cleaner, but this can be accomplished in a more straightforward way (for example adding a .is_unique() method to some models that need it and make sure that columns are indexed properly. (Another option is to make columns unique together with the 'Deleted' column instead, but this should then be done explicitly on models using UniqueConstraint)

I'm not going to -1 it and wait to see what core reviewers have to say, but I think it is not an approach we should take."}, {'account_id': 2889, 'date': '2012-11-15 13:51:43.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 1: I would prefer that you didn't merge this

I think this is a start in the right direction, but I do not like using `deleted_at` for enforcing uniqueness for a variety of reasons and would like to see this done via copying the row `id` into the `deleted` field instead. 

I posted a much longer comment on the previous patchset (16162)."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-15 22:40:38.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 1: Do not merge

revisions:
[{'created': '2012-11-15 09:37:59.000000000', 'message': "Add unique constraints to check duplicates in DB.

There are several places in nova where entries are not checked for duplication.
Existing duplicate checks are not optimal since multiple DB accesses required.

With unique constraints in place DB checks duplicate entries automaticaly.
Since nova uses soft deletes we must put deleted_at in all constraints.
The problem is that NULL values aren't equal in SQL DB. (NULL == NULL is false)
To fix this issue we set deleted_at default value to 1970/1/1.

Add 138_add_composite_indexes.py (add unique constraints for affected models).

Fix a bug in sqlalchemy db models save method (exception was not raised).
Also add a new exception that indicates duplicated columns.

Add test_create_safe_duplicate_vlan_exception() to check that exception is raised.

Add test_update_duplicate_vlan_exception() to check that exception is raised.

Change-Id: I3c98b3952858188924359b16c040c107e61f507c
"}]
commit_message:
Add unique constraints to check duplicates in DB.

There are several places in nova where entries are not checked for duplication.
Existing duplicate checks are not optimal since multiple DB accesses required.

With unique constraints in place DB checks duplicate entries automaticaly.
Since nova uses soft deletes we must put deleted_at in all constraints.
The problem is that NULL values aren't equal in SQL DB. (NULL == NULL is false)
To fix this issue we set deleted_at default value to 1970/1/1.

Add 138_add_composite_indexes.py (add unique constraints for affected models).

Fix a bug in sqlalchemy db models save method (exception was not raised).
Also add a new exception that indicates duplicated columns.

Add test_create_safe_duplicate_vlan_exception() to check that exception is raised.

Add test_update_duplicate_vlan_exception() to check that exception is raised.

Change-Id: I3c98b3952858188924359b16c040c107e61f507c

commit_message:
Don't update arch twice when create server

During the instance creation a dictionary of instance characteristics
(base_options) is created in nova.compute.api._create_instance where
"architecture" is defined looking into image[properties].
Then "architecture" entry is updated to the same value in
nova.compute.api._populate_instance_for_create if defined or it removes
the 'Unknown' value for this key.

This patch removes the unnecessary "architecture" update.

Change-Id: Id76dedef8fc96dcd6fa5b72ace6c50c85e04215b

really minor comment inline'}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-11-19 07:48:43.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2: (2 inline comments)

(2 inline comments)

"}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-19 16:59:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Doug: monkeypatching datetime is actually kind of tricky since Datetime objects can be constructed in a number of ways. I think you might be able to do it by creating a fake Datetime class and monkeypatching it into the datetime module, but when I last tried it got pretty ugly. If someone wants to try modifying timeutils.utcnow() to just pass through datetime.datetime.utcnow() and set and clear time override to monkeypatch the datetime module, that seems fine. Then we could move the override stuff into fakes.

I think this route was chosen because it involves less magic'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-19 17:06:37.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

VIsh: Would it be easier to just mock timeutils.utcnow() directly? I guess there's a use case that isn't obvious that makes mocking datetime.datetime necessary."}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-19 17:13:36.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Doug: unfortunately, no, as it is a builtin:
 >>> datetime.datetime.utcnow = lambda: 7 
 Traceback (most recent call last):
   File "<input>", line 1, in <module>
 TypeError: can't set attributes of built-in/extension type 'datetime.datetime'

And even if we could, we would have to make sure that no one is calling datetime.datetime.now() or datetime.datetime.today() or creating a datetime using datetime.datetime() and then calling utcnow() on it'}, {'account_id': 67, 'date': '2012-11-19 17:17:16.000000000', 'content': 'Patch Set 2:

Doug: ah sorry, I misread your comment. Sure we could move the mocking to mock timeutils and stick the helper methods into the testing class or somewhere in the tests/ directory.'}, {'account_id': 2472, 'date': '2012-11-19 17:21:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 2:

If you want to replace what timeutils.utcnow() returns you wouldn't have to change datetime.datetime.utcnow, you could just do:

with mock.patch('timeutils.utcnow') as m:
  m.return_value = datetime.datetime(some constant arguments go here)
  call to function that uses timeutils.utcnow here

As far as different parts of the code creating datetime objects in some other way, neither a mock nor using the mocking feature built into timeutils.utcnow() solves that problem. :-/

/me needs more hours in a day"}, {'account_id': 2284, 'date': '2012-11-19 17:51:59.000000000', 'content': 'Uploaded patch set 3.'}, {'account_id': 3, 'date': '2012-11-19 17:56:24.000000000', 'content': "Patch Set 3: Doesn't seem to work

commit_message:
Account for tasks duration in LoopingCall delay

Fixes bug 1079725

Previously the time spent executing tasks was not accounted for
when determining how much time to sleep between task runs.

Now we subtract the duration of the last tasks run from the next
sleep interval.

Change-Id: I4b3e27d4aaa21d020159d46eea40bdd80361cea7

commit_message:
Convenience wrapper for datetime.timedelta.total_seconds()

Allows time deltas in seconds to be concisely calculated
for py26 and py27.

Change-Id: I8987af1f892fda0a72f5eb0d45f94c595792dc78

commit_message:
Improve the performance of quantum detection.

Per https://review.openstack.org/#/c/14700 -- related to bug 1070509.

Change-Id: Ib9f829823136401a034b6bd3e1591508301132ba

It is possible that a user is no longer a member of a tenant when
they attempt to use an ec2 token. This checks to make sure that

'}]
commit_message:
Ensures User is member of tenant in ec2 validation

It is possible that a user is no longer a member of a tenant when
they attempt to use an ec2 token. This checks to make sure that
the user still has at least one valid role in the tenant before
authenticating them. This should automatically work for the s3
version as well since it is a subclass.

Fixes bug 1064914

Change-Id: Ieb237bae936a7b00ce7ba4d4c59aec6c7a69ec21

commit_message:
pin sqlalchemy to 0.7

sqlalchemy 0.8.0b1 breaks some dependencies such as sqlalchemy-migrate, pin the version until we fix them

Essex backport note: lower bound is not defined, Essex is known to work
with older sqlalchemy versions e.g. precise has 0.7.4

Fixes bug #1073569

Change-Id: I6620276bf8f0a7cbc1d51aa226cd33c512e59a48

Fixes bug #1081836

Commit d3fd05b1f accidentally removed the default for the compute_driver
option because the default has been removed for grizzly.

That commit isn't yet needed on stable/folsom, but will be needed by
the fix for #1061944 so rather than revert it we should fix it by
restoring the default value.

Change-Id: I339e98b7f787867f06f01fa3d5a925cec7fbdefd
"}]
commit_message:
Restore the default for compute_driver option

Fixes bug #1081836

Commit d3fd05b1f accidentally removed the default for the compute_driver
option because the default has been removed for grizzly.

That commit isn't yet needed on stable/folsom, but will be needed by
the fix for #1061944 so rather than revert it we should fix it by
restoring the default value.

Change-Id: I339e98b7f787867f06f01fa3d5a925cec7fbdefd

commit_message:
Don't require quantumclient when running nova-api.

Handle ImportErrors's when importing the quantumv2 API
in the Nova API servers controller. This makes it possible
to run nova-api when quantumclient is not present.

This was recently broken in commit 83a8418 which changed how we
import the quantum v2 API class.

Fixes LP Bug #1070509.

Change-Id: I3c452c3bd88cb5b431cb23e525ff78e3d677e1a8
(cherry picked from commit fd4bb5e153118b327b7d958810b28513a0057d27)

commit_message:
Ensures compute_driver flag can be used by bdm

Fixes bug 1063851 by moving compute_driver flag from
compute/manager.py to the global flags.py

Change-Id: I337795f6956050b398c39a8476e3c1e2b689c470
Signed-off-by: Chuck Short <chuck.short@canonical.com>
